Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** with a skillset and a heart for helping residents make the most of each day. In this position, you'll be a friendly and familiar face to our residents, providing hands-on care in a respectful and dignified manner. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care you bring to the services you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
* Escorting residents to meals and recreational activities
* Supporting residents in achieving their highest level of physical, emotional and psycho-social well-being
* Helping out as needed in the Wellness area to ensure the safety, comfort and wellbeing of our residents
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness

**Qualifications:**

* NJ-Certified Nursing Assistant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times

Acting as the shift supervisor in the absence of the Director, you will provide caring and attentive help to residents in managing their activities of daily living (ADLs) as well as in the administration of their medications — all while leading the team in caring for residents with skill and genuine kindness. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care and professionalism you bring to the services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.

* Must have staff supervisory and medication oversight experience, preferably in an assisted living, nursing home or similar environment

* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus

title: Waitstaff – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking friendly, professional and, above all, compassionate **Waitstaff** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Patiently and cheerfully taking resident meal orders
* Checking station tables for settings and cleanliness
* Reading the menu before service so that you can knowledgeably assist the residents with their selections
* Assisting in the plating and proper portion controls of some or all of the following: appetizers, salads, soups, beverages and desserts
* Bussing tables at the end of the meal

**Must be able to work at least one weekend day per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Experience as a Waiter/Waitress in a restaurant or food-service-related industry
* Able to function in a fast-paced environment
* Have a strong ability to multi-task
* Possesses good communication, customer service and people skills
* Is professional, patient and able to satisfy a demanding customer base
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Is a team player, willing to help out where needed to ensure a pleasurable dining experience
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times

**New Jersey locations: Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**

title: Community Manager
description:
***Welcome to Mill Creek! We’re glad you’re here!*** *At Mill Creek Residential we are committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace where our associates can grow and bring their whole selves to work. This starts with our recruiting and hiring process.* *Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We want you to know that we encourage you to apply if this job excites you, even if you don’t meet 100% of the requirements. You may just be the right candidate for this role, or another role and make your mark at Mill Creek.*

The Community Manager drives financial performance, operational and leasing excellence, and delivers outstanding customer service at one or more communities. Provides leadership and management for the community operations and maintenance teams. This position is responsible for setting performance standards and coaching, developing, and empowering associates towards achievement of desired business outcome.

Essential Functions/Responsibilities

**Financial Performance**

* Manage financial aspects of operations for the assigned community (or communities) that contribute to the business goals.
* Develop, implement, and monitor programs to maximize revenue, maintain expense control, and increase value
* Oversee pricing and occupancy strategies
* Assist in preparation of community budget
* Provide thorough and strategic monthly reforecast, monthly operating report, and executive summary of operations
* Review and approve, or submit for approval, all contracts within the limits defined by MCR budget authority levels
* Anticipate and communicate significant departures from the budget immediately and in accordance with the company policy and standards
* Partner with community Service Manager to review and recommend capital improvements and capital programs for expense reduction
* Address and complete all other duties as assigned

**Sales and Marketing**

* Oversee sales, lease renewals, move-in and move-out process
* Oversee administration and completion of the resident renewal program, move-in and move out process
* Maintain accurate and in-depth knowledge of community inventory, pricing and availability as well as general knowledge of competitors
* Foster a thorough understanding of the community’s competitive environment in a submarket and adjust operating strategy accordingly
* Participate in Revenue Management calls when applicable
* Address and complete all other duties as assigned

**Operating Standards**

* Ensure community (communities) maintain brand standards including property presentation, marketing, office and model appearance and associate appearance. Inspect what you expect.
* Review and analyze operations reports to track community performance and understand the impact of local economic conditions on community operations
* Ensure community is compliant with all applicable MCR and Partner (where applicable) procedures and all federal, state and local laws, specifically Fair Housing regulations at the community level
* Partnering with Service Manager, recommend capital improvements for community
* Manage contracts with 3rd party service providers
* Address and complete all other duties as assigned

**Associate Management and Development**

* Responsible for recruiting, hiring, associate scheduling, work assignments, training and performance evaluations
* Empower, engage and develop associates to achieve great performance and desired business outcomes.
* Establish goals and accountability for team. Provide feedback, coaching and support to drive achievement of established goals, reward success: hold one on one meetings with staff members
* Manage performance of subordinates. Conduct performance appraisals; provide development support (i.e. coaching, counseling and training); make decisions regarding hiring or termination of community associates
* Support associate development. Provide targeted training and growth opportunities
* Champion and enforce the Mill Creek Brand Promise, Service Standards and Manifesto
* Address and complete all other duties as assigned

Education and/or Experience

* High School diploma or equivalent (GED), Bachelor’s degree or related experience preferred
* 3-5 years of multi-family or related property management experience or equivalent experience
* 2 years supervisory experience
* Commitment to, and passion for, providing outstanding customer service
* Strong communication skills (written and verbal)

Skills/Specialized Knowledge

* Manage community performance including financial performance, customer service, sales, communications, marketing, negotiation, crisis management and staffing
* Analyze data/reports to develop solutions to sustain high standards of customer service, optimal revenue generation and effective expense management
* Ability to set clear objectives and define success for individuals and the team. Establish team accountability and lead team to achieve desired business outcomes
* Supervise subordinates and provide feedback and coaching resulting in improved performance
* Exercise professional judgment to take ownership of and resolve issues and problems with residents and associates diplomatically and without becoming adversarial and losing your temper
* Ability to clearly communicate, speak, read and write in English as demonstrated by clear and concise written and verbal communication
* Computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, Entrata, Yardi and Revenue Management Software
* Ability to perform basic arithmetic skills such as measurement, addition, subtraction, multiplication and division
* Operate general office equipment, such as, but not limited to, personal computer, tablet, telephone and successfully program fobs and other electronic devices
* Capable of travelling between two or more communities, if necessary
* Report to work on time, work assigned schedules (including weekends) and accurately document/verify time worked

*Mill Creek is an Equal Opportunity Employer*

**Are you ready to contribute to the success of Mill Creek Residential? If so, apply today and become part of an organization that believes in uncompromising integrity, celebrating successes, continuous improvement, and working hard, smart and together!**

title: Assistant Warehouse Manager
description:
**What’s Our Vision and Purpose?**

At **Manhattan Beer Distributors**, our vision is to be the leading beer distributor in the market.

Imagine building a business from the ground up, with nothing more than 1 truck, 4000 feet of warehouse space, 2 Beer Brands and a lot of determination! Simon Bergson, founder and owner of Manhattan Beer Distributors, has done exactly this, growing our business over the last 40 years to exponential heights. Manhattan Beer Distributors now has 1.5 million feet of warehouse space, the distribution rights to 300 brands, 400 trucks and services 15 counties. Our aim is to provide great service to all of our customers from the convenience store owner to our big chain operators, restaurants, bars and hotels.

Hard work, grit and a “can do” spirit are our hallmarks.

**Come Join Our Family…..**

We couldn’t do what we do without our team. Not only do we want to develop our brands and our business, we want to develop our people, making Manhattan Beer Distributors a great place to work. It doesn’t matter how large we get. We’ll always be family. For this reason, we are committed to your success, coaching, and development.

Our business is growing, and we need smart and talented people like you to help us get where we want to be!

**Your Main Focus Will Be:** 

* **Position Requirements:**
* Ensure productivity, accuracy, and timely completion of the loading/unloading operation.
* Adhering to all safety regulations and OSHA requirements.
* Manage product rotation and product replenishment processes.
* Contribute to warehouse organization and housekeeping.
* Assist in the process of receiving incoming freight when needed.
* Assist in the training and development of new employees.
* Accurately send/receive transfers to and from other warehouses.
* Assist in managing overtime & all other operational costs relative to day operations.
* Assist other departments (Recycling, Delivery) with the check-in and check-out.
* Associate's degree is a plus.
* Minimum of 3 years of supervisory experience in receiving and distribution.
* Experience working with a unionized workforce.
* Basic familiarity with Microsoft Excel and Word. Advanced skills are a plus.
* Familiarity with Warehouse Management Systems. Eostar and Vocallect a plus.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills.
* Solid time management skills, ability to prioritize, and work under deadlines.
* Baseline knowledge of DOT and OSHA regulations.
* Understands the concept of FIFO and has slotting experience.

Salary: $70,000.00-$75,000.00

It is not typical for offers to be made at or near the top of the range. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors, including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to salary and a generous employee benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* The work schedule is Tuesday to Saturday, 9 am to 7 pm ( Saturday, 8 am to 6 pm)

Experience:

* supervisory in receiving and distribution.: 3 years (Required)
* working with a unionized workforce.: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

Responsible for extensive fluoroscopy duties. Responsible for all quality related to general radiology at the West Nyack Ambulatory Imaging Center (under 10 minutes from Hospital). Operates radiologic equipment to produce radiographs (X-Rays) of body for diagnostic purposes, as directed by RADIOLOGIST: Positions patient on examining table and adjusts immobilization devices to obtain optimum views of specified area of body requested by physician. Explains procedures to patient to reduce anxieties and obtain patient cooperation. Moves X-Ray equipment into specified position and adjusts equipment controls to set exposure factors, such as time and distance, based on knowledge of radiographic exposure techniques and protocols. Practices radiation protection techniques, using beam restrictive devices, patient shielding skills, and knowledge of applicable exposure factors, to minimize radiation to patient and staff.


QUALIFICATIONS

title: After School Group Leader - The Village of Pleasantville (Panther Club)
description:
**Panther Club After-School Group Leader**

The Village of Pleasantville’s Parks & Recreation Department is seeking eligible candidates for their 2024-2025 Panther Club After School Program.

Get paid to PLAY! Panther Club is an after-school program that operates during the school year, **Monday-Friday from 2:30pm-6:00pm.** Staff is expected to supervise a specific elementary grade level of children during games, outdoor play, and homework periods. The ideal candidate will have high-energy, take initiative, and have experience supervising or interacting with children in a day care, camp, after-school, classroom, or similar setting. Additional staff requirements and position duties include:

* Acquiring and maintaining CPR, AED and First Aid certifications and OCFS and NYS mandated trainings (The Village of Pleasantville supports staff in these efforts).
* Fully understanding and respecting OCFS and Village of Pleasantville guidelines for safety and compliance including maintaining 1:10 staff-to-child ratio, keeping attendance and daily occurrence records, maintaining program quality and control at all times, communicating effectively and efficiently with the administrative staff, etc.
* Developing and implementing activities for the program to keep participants moving, enthusiastic, and engaged.
* Be a community ambassador by taking initiative, speaking with parents, facilitating sign-in and sign-out procedures and maintaining a safe space for participants at all times.
* Candidates must be reliable, responsible, and capable of teamwork and collaboration to ensure overall program quality and consistency.

MINIMUM ACCEPTABLE TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE: Graduation from high school or possession of a high school equivalency diploma and three (3) years of experience in which the primary function of the position was conducting recreation activities, programs or services.

SUBSTITUTION 1: Satisfactory completion of 30 credits towards a Bachelor’s Degree\\* in Recreation, Parks Resources, Leisure Services, Physical Education or a related field may be substituted on a year for year basis for the above work experience.

SUBSTITUTION 2: Possession of current Certified Park and Recreation Professional (CPRP) status conferred by the National Recreation and Park Association or one of its authorized and recognized affiliates may be substituted for the above work experience.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 17.5 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Intimate Apparel Product Management/Technical Design Assistant
description:
**Product Management/Technical Design Assistant**

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

Leading Apparel company looking for an Assistant to our Product Management & Technical Design teams.

An ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills, excellent communication skills, an understanding of the production and design process, and the ability to manage and prioritize workload with a sense of urgency to the team as well as provide a strong supportive role to the managers on the team. This is an entry-level position with 0-2 years of relevant experience in the fashion industry.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

**·** Provide full support for the Product Management & Technical Design teams.

· Communicate daily with cross-functional teams and overseas offices.

· Track, receive, login, distribute & confirm receipt of all packages (samples/approvals, etc.) daily.

· Responsible for domestic & international outbound package preparation and follow-up (creating labels, boxing up & dropping off packages).

· Maintain sample closet, fabric & material library, & color swatch organization. Order office/shipping supplies, Pantone chips, etc as necessary.

· Assemble color cards for China & Bangladesh offices by brand, license, or customer.

· Pull sample & color references for tech packs as needed.

· Assemble T&A/WIP reports weekly.

· Assist with bi-weekly fittings – taking photos, taking notes, creating fit agenda.

· Measure samples & organize Technical Design racks as needed.

· Assist in communication with factories involving product development.

· Assist VP of Product Management with special projects as needed.

· Reports to VP of Product Management regarding daily responsibilities.

**CANDIDATES MUST HAVE**

**·** Excellent organizational skills.

· Strong written and verbal communication skills.

· Strong sense of urgency, accuracy, and responsibility.

· Proficient Computer Skills including Microsoft Office & PLM programs (Photoshop/Illustrator a plus).

· Hardworking, dedicated, and flexible, while multi-tasking in a fast-paced team-oriented environment.

· Positive attitude, ability to take initiative & think outside the box.

· Knowledge of Intimates garment construction a plus.

· Knowledge of written & spoken Mandarin a plus.

**EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS**

· Bachelor’s degree preferred in Product Management, Fashion Design or Textile Surface Design, Textile/Science.

· 0-2 years of work experience in the field.

Job Type: Full-time, in-office (Fridays remote), midtown Manhattan

title: Optician I - 038
description:
Optician I
  
  

General Job Description & Responsibilities
  
  

The primary responsibility of this position is to ensure that all patients are receiving the best quality of care at all times. Primary responsibilities include:
  
  

* Review Physician’s prescriptions and orders based on medical charts
* Educate patients on their corrective lens options and help them make a choice that fits their medical needs as well as lifestyle preferences
* Provide honest but compassionate feedback about aesthetic choices in frames
* Achieve sales goals and quotas as determined by office staff while attending to patients’ specific needs and desires
* Manage inventory of frames and contact lenses to ensure optimum customer satisfaction and product variety
* Communicate with physician with questions or concerns about prescriptions and other eye-related issues
* Perform adjustments and repairs of eyewear
* Place optical orders with a general understanding of insurance benefits


Experience & Skills
  
Excellent customer service skills and personal presentation are critical to this role. The ideal candidate will have 1-3 years of experience and:
  
* ABO License highly preferred
* Optical Sales
* Good organizational and multitasking abilities
* Coachable-open to feedback and continual improvement
* Flexible and adaptable
* Professional phone and office etiquette required


Other Duties & Information
  
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. This position reports to the Practice Manager, or their designee.

title: Retail Store Manager - Calling All Dog Lovers!
description:
Well Bred, the Heathy Pet Marketplace and Gentle Grooming Salon is looking for an experienced Store Manager for our store in Livingston NJ.

In this job, you will be: 1) growing retail sales , 2) managing all aspect of the store operations, including ordering merchandise and processing the deliveries, 3) managing the operations and scheduling of the grooming salon, 4) managing and growing employes. We expect that you will be a driving force for growing our business and sales.

Superior customers service skills are must! Love for dogs and cats are must!

As a part of management team, on occasion you will also be working in our other locations for training, training other employees, filling for other managers and other situations (all our locations are within 0.5-1 hour drive).

You are an ideal candidate if you meet following criteria:

* You have proven experience in growing sales and business.
* You have an experience in consultative selling approach.
* You are hands on manager and are a true leader who motivates and mentors their grow their employees.
* You are a "people person" who loves creating relationships
* You love friendly competition.
* You love dogs or cats and have a lot of experience with them.
* You stayed in your previous jobs min 2 years and are looking for a long term opportunity.
* You have analytical skills and attention to details to manage the store operations (not easy!)

We are looking for a serious candidate who enjoys smaller business environment.

As a store manager, you will:

* Be responsible for growing sales and meeting sales growth goals, according to our strategy and using our sales techniques.
* Become a dog and cat product expert and canine. Become an expert in canine nutrition.
* Provide outstanding customer service and making each customer feeling welcome and loving our store - that includes treating visiting dogs with treats :).
* Organize and participate in events in the store, and in the area (outreach marketing).
* Become a mentor and a trainer to our employees and helping them grow professionally.
* Assure they use our selling techniques and have proper product knowledge.
* Manage the store like it was your own business.
* Manage the retail employees and operations of your retail store, which including merchandising up to our standards, keeping your store clean , organized, and presentable, managing inventory, analyzing sales and inventory reports, making timely orders proposals, placing orders, receiving deliveries, requesting credits and paperwork filing and anything else that is required to manage your store properly
* Manage the grooming salon, groomers and grooming schedule (in Chester and Livingston).
* Work 45 hours a week on average (but up to 50 on a rare occasion, for which you will be adequately compensated)
* Have fun!

Our managers are a very important part of the business and their role is beyond managing the store and grooming.

Sales skills, customer service skills, attention to details, ability to follow the processes are required. Completed test skills are required before the interview.

You must be able to use your experience with dogs in this job when advicing on products and be able to interact with dogs in safe when trying products on them. If you have experience with cats in addition to dogs, it's even better.

Since you will be working on the floor, you must be able to stand on your feet for an entire shift (up to 9 hours) as well as lift 30lb bags of dog food.

You will be working on the computer to check out employees but also perform your on managerail tasks so computer skills are required (POS, basic Excel and Word).

Weekends are required (one or both weekend days depending on the business need).

All our managers are expected to work in other stores if there is a need for it. So you have to be able to commute to them if needed (the must further stores are 1 hour apart).

Previous retail management or restaurant management experience is required.

***Please send your resume and a cover letter explaining why this job is for you and why you are the best candidate!***

**We offer:**

* Great working environment.
* Health, vision and dental insurance (must work full time).
* Paid Time Off.
* 25% discount on everything in the store.
* Complementary dog and cat foods of selected brands.
* Deep training in canine and feline nutrition.
* Very fair pay that depends on the hours and efforts you put in the job.

It's a very interesting job and will bring you a lot of satisfaction if you love it. You will work with a very nice team and with great repeat customers.

Well Bred offers better products and healthy nutrition for dogs and cats and gentle grooming. Currently, we have 6 locations in Madison, Chester, Chatham, Livingston, Clinton and Bernardsville, NJ

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $54,000.00 - $64,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift

* Do you have any experience with consultative selling? Please elaborate on your experience and skills.
* This job will require you to work in other stores in case of other managers or key employees time off, vacation, sickness, or terminations. Are you able to commute to our other stores if needed?
* Why do you want to work for Well Bred? Why this position? Why are you the best candidate for this job?

title: Quality Assurance Coordinator OPWDD
description:
**Community Options, Inc.** is a national non-profit agency providing services to individuals with disabilities in 12 states.

We are searching for an experienced **Quality Assurance Coordinator** in **Brookly**n**, NY** who will be responsible for monitoring the systematic operations of the residential and vocational programs. This person will serve as a liaison between the local office and the national office. This person will be held accountable for ensuring the appropriate implementation of policies and procedures and, ensuring programs are completely in compliance with state rules, regulations and agency policies.

***The hourly rate is is $24.038 a hour***

**Responsibilities:**

* Schedules and conducts QA audits of financial, personnel files to include training records, medication administration records, medical records, Therap and billing documentation
* Conduct comprehensive record reviews
* Conducts physical site inspections of homes and programs
* Submits a quarterly report card to the National Compliance and QA Director and to the Regional/State Director
* Conducts 30-day initial audit of all new homes and programs
* Coordination of the annual peer audits
* Audits individuals’ in-house accounts to verify that required documentation is maintained, accounts are monitored by the designated staff and balances are correct
* Communicates findings of audits to the Regional/State Director, Executive Director and National Compliance and QA Director
* Recommends any necessary changes in current policy and procedures
* Member of the National & Local QA committees
* Conducts staff training as needed
* Conducts investigations as needed
* Maintains a master file of all audits
* Must Cooperate with the licensee and department staff in any inspection, inquiry or investigation
* Additional tasks and responsibilities may be assigned

**Minimum Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in a related field and three years of relevant experience
* Valid driver’s license with a satisfactory driving record
* Commitment to and knowledge of community-based support for persons with disabilities
* Working knowledge of management of an effective QA program, including training, monitoring, conducting and documenting investigations, addressing violations and monitoring corrective actions
* Ability to maintain effective relationships with employees, new hires, and the general public
* Excellent time management skills and the ability to develop and implement multiple priorities
* Ability to present facts and recommendations effectively in oral and written form
* Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize, and organize diversified workload
* Ability to demonstrate poise, tact, and diplomacy
* Excellent presentation and verbal skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Office 365
* Knowledge and understanding of local regulatory agency operations

**Working Conditions:**

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handling multiple priorities
* While performing the duties of the job, employee travels by automobile, utilizing own vehicle, and is exposed to changing weather conditions
* Travels throughout a designated region
* Minimal hazards, general office working conditions
* Flexible schedule as determined by supervisor
* May be exposed to various medical conditions and communicable diseases

**Why Community Options?**

* Competitive Insurance Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* Paid Holidays—Including a Birthday Holiday
* Generous PTO
* Employee Incentive & Discount Programs
* 403b Retirement Plan
* Incredible career growth opportunities

*Community Options is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V*

#IND-BR

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $24.38 per hour

Work Location: In person
company_description: Community Options, Inc's mission is to develop housing and employment supports for persons with disabilities.

title: QA Assistant
description:
We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Quality Assurance Assistant to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring that our products meet the highest standards of quality and compliance. This position involves conducting inspections, analyzing data, and collaborating with various departments to uphold quality assurance protocols in accordance with industry regulations.

Responsibilities:

- Perform quality inspections on products throughout the manufacturing process to ensure compliance with specifications.

- Collect and analyze data related to product quality, identifying trends and areas for improvement.

- Collaborate with fabrication teams to ensure that all processes adhere to CGMP (Current Good Manufacturing Practices) and FDA regulations.

- Maintain documentation in accordance with SQF standards and assist in audits as necessary.

- Implement Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) principles to monitor food safety practices within production processes.

- Participate in continuous improvement initiatives aimed at enhancing product quality and operational efficiency.

Skills

- Strong understanding of quality inspection techniques and methodologies.

- Experience in data collection and analysis related to manufacturing processes.

- Familiarity with SQF, HACCP, and FDA regulations is highly desirable.

- Detail-oriented mindset with strong analytical skills for problem-solving.

- Proficiency in Microsoft 365 applications.

- Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration across departments.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Door to Door Sales Representative
description:
**\\*\\*Launch Your Career in Solar Sales with Organic Light – No Experience Needed!\\*\\***

Are you ready to jump into an exciting new career with unlimited potential?

Organic Light, a dynamic black-owned solar sales company, is on the hunt for passionate individuals to join our fast-growing team – no experience required! If you’re eager to learn, make an impact, and grow alongside a booming industry, this is the perfect opportunity to shine. With the surge in government incentives, tax credits, and rebates, now’s the time to show homeowners the game-changing power of solar energy – and you’ll be right at the forefront of this movement.

**\\*\\*What You’ll Do:\\*\\***

*- \\*\\*Learn & Grow:\\*\\** We’ll take you from solar novice to sales pro in just 90 days! Our in-depth training will equip you with all the tools and knowledge to thrive in this industry.

*- \\*\\*Spread the Solar Buzz:\\*\\** You’ll be the friendly face educating homeowners about solar's many perks—saving money, going green, and busting common myths—without any upfront costs for them!

*- \\*\\*Scout Solar Homes & Set Appointments:\\*\\** You’ll identify homes that are perfect for solar, spark interest, and set up appointments for our solar experts to deliver personalized consultations.

*- \\*\\*Get Hands-On Experience:\\*\\** Attend immersive training and ride-alongs with seasoned pros to gain real-world sales experience and boost your confidence.

*- \\*\\*Grow Your Network:\\*\\** With your charm, communication skills, and referral-building magic, you’ll expand your client base in no time.

**\\*\\*What’s in It for You:\\*\\***

*- \\*\\*Big Earnings, Fast:\\*\\** Start with a clear path to six figures—our solar pros average $100k–$150k per year, with top performers raking in $225k+!

*- \\*\\*Unlimited Commission & Bonuses:\\*\\* T*he sky’s the limit for your earnings with uncapped commissions, and up to $7,000 in bonus potential within your first 7 weeks!

*- \\*\\*Top-Notch Training:\\*\\** You’ll get world-class training and ongoing support, ensuring you succeed every step of the way.

*- \\*\\*Flexible Hours & Team Support:\\*\\** Enjoy a mix of flexible working hours and a collaborative, supportive team that has your back.

*- \\*\\*Career Growth Opportunities:\\*\\** As our company expands, you’ll have the chance to grow with us and even own your own franchise in the thriving solar industry!

**\\*\\*Who We’re Looking For:\\*\\***

- Stellar communicators who can easily build rapport and trust with homeowners. **Bilingual**candidates are a huge plus!

- A positive, can-do attitude with a strong work ethic.

- Fast learners with a student mentality who are eager to grow.

- Willingness to work outdoors, walk long distances, and embrace weekend work when needed.

- Reliable transportation is a plus, but not a dealbreaker – great communication skills via phone, text, and email are a must.

- A go-getter mentality with a deep desire to succeed and make a difference.

**\\*\\*Why Choose Us?\\*\\***

- Be part of something \\*big\\*! Help drive the transition to a cleaner, more sustainable future.

- Step into one of the most exciting, rapidly growing industries with endless earning potential.

- Feel the pride of making a positive impact by helping homeowners save money and embrace renewable energy.

**Ready to start your solar adventure and light the way to a brighter future? Join our high-energy team at Organic Light and make your mark in solar sales today!**

description:
**Day Habilitation Without Walls Instructor**

**Direct Support Professionals—take your career to the next level!**

At ***AABR***, you’ll get to do truly meaningful work--empowering individuals with disabilities to live their best lives. For over six decades, our stellar team has been at the forefront, providing services that foster independence and community involvement. Whether it's our innovative Day Habilitation programs with vocational training and life skills, to our nurturing Residential homes, you'll play a key role in creating brighter futures. Join our mission to unlock limitless potential.

**We give you:**

* **A place to work where kindness abounds.**
* **Best in the Industry leaders to help you drive positive change.**
* **Sign on Bonus!**
* **Fully Paid Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance!**
* **A diverse & inclusive environment to thrive.**
* **Superior training & mentorship programs to fast track your career**
* **401(k) & Retirement Plan**
* **Life insurance**
* **Generous paid time off**
* **Referral program**

Reporting directly to the Chief Program Officer and the Director of Day Services, the **Day Habilitation without Walls Instructor provides the opportunity for people with Developmental Disabilities to learn new skills, build relationships and develop self- esteem through volunteerism outside the traditional setting**. All-day habilitation services are person centered to support each Individual in discovering their interests while improving their communication and socialization skills--focusing on opportunities for building successful and meaningful interactions with other members of the community. **Your responsibilities include:**

* Transport people to/from community sites, as well as, to volunteer job opportunity locations.
* Assist people in achieving success & satisfaction in personal growth in community-based endeavors.
* Ensure the safety of program volunteers while at the program site, agency locations, community volunteer jobs and other hub sites.
* Schedule activities that are in conjunction with the life plan and are person-centered in the community.
* Communicate with the residential sites where the Individuals live and with their families.
* Provide written schedules for planning one month at a time.
* Participate in training, seminars and conferences.

**We require:**

* **High School Diploma**
* **Minimum 2 years of experience supporting people with developmental disabilities**
* **Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.**
* **Valid NYS Driver’s License is essential**
* Experience working with people with developmental disabilities is preferred.
* Learn more! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2z1y7vq56hc

Don’t miss out on the chance to have a career you love with growth potential!

**Salary $20.57/hour.** For immediate consideration, **please email: habdulhaqq@aabr.org**

At AABR, we value all employees and job candidates as unique individuals, and we welcome the variety of experiences they bring to our agency. As such, we have a strict non-discrimination policy. We believe everyone should be treated equally regardless of race, sex, gender identification, sexual orientation, national origin, native language, religion, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, pregnancy or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: REGISTERED DIETITIAN - FEEDING PROGRAM
company: St Mary's Healthcare System for Children
description:
The Registered Dietitian evaluates plans, implements and documents nutritional care based on program policies, procedures and regulatory standards through the application of the nutritional guidelines for clinic and day patients ranging in age from 0 - adolescence. Provides parent/staff education, assesses patient’s progress and performs duties necessary for program development and research projects. Supports facility’s mission to provide the highest quality care by complying with regulatory guidelines, meeting facility standards, and obtaining appropriate certification.

**JOB DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES**

1. Completes nutrition assessments and reassessments including documentation of changes on  
nutritional progression or regression. Develops, implements and promotes quality, evidence –  
based medical nutrition therapy to meet each patient's needs.

2. Completes documentation/reports accurately and in a timely manner according to policies.

3. Develops nutritional care plans and monitors day patient diets. Includes application of principles relative to child/adolescent growth in developing nutrition care plans.

4. Functions as an integral part of the Interdisciplinary Team by collaborating with other team  
members.

5. Provides input into the design and implementation of weekly menus and special diets.

6. Creates material and educates families, team members and other healthcare professionals in  
principles of nutrition and modifications of normal diet.

7. Collects weekly weights of day patients and recommends diet modification accordingly.

8. Develops weekend nutrition plan for day patients in collaboration with primary Feeding Therapists, Clinical Supervisor and families.

9. Attends family meetings, in-services, and department meetings and serves on a variety of  
patient care and strategic planning committees, as assigned by the Director.

10. Calculates calorie count for day patients, as needed.

11. Provides consultation services to school, daycare, and extended family as needed.

12. Provides input and assists with G-tube management/reduction (as necessary) in collaboration with Nurse Practitioner, primary Feeding Therapists and Clinical Supervisor.

13. Completes productivity tracking sheet accurately and in a timely manner.

***Formal education required:***

Bachelor’s Degree required; Master’s preferred.

Registered Dietitian from the Commission on Dietetic Registration.

CDN licensed in NYS a plus.

***Previous experience required:***

Minimum of two year of health care experience in pediatric setting.

Computer proficiency.

Bilingual a plus.

title: HHA - Home Health Aide / 15 hours total. M-F, 3pm-6pm. MONROE, NY
description:
**Looking to hire a DSP/Caregiver or HHA to work 15 hours a week: M-F 3pm-6m. Monroe, NY.**

Seeking an experienced support professional who has chosen this field because they are committed to making a positive difference in the lives of people with developmental disabilities through a career in health or mental care.

You have at least a high school degree with experience in direct and active support of people with autism, down's syndrome, etc. or even better, a bachelor's degree in a field related to health and mental care: psychology, special education, mental health, behavioral science, etc. We offer competitive pay and benefits in a fast-growing, start-up-like environment where the right combination of independent, creative thinking and enthusiastic teamwork will guarantee career growth.

You will be responsible for supporting our program participant.

**Provide Safety & Support**

* Ensure health, safety and welfare of client with developmental disabilities.
* Safeguard and respect the confidentiality of the individual and their family.
* Promote individual's independence.
* Assist to develop and maintain relationships.
* Promote and protect the health, safety and emotional well-being of the client.
* Commit to person-centered supports and honor the personality, preferences, culture and strengths of the client.
* Work in partnership with client to support to lead self-directed lives.
* Implement and adhere to established actionable plans.
* Ability to communicate effectively.
* Be able to establish rapport and communicate positively with parents.
* Provide information to parents about behaviors and interactions with the child.

**Administrative & Company Policies**

* Commitment to company values and adherence to policies.
* Uphold the standards set by the National Alliance for Direct Support Professionals (NADSP) Code of Ethics.
* Be familiar with fire evacuation and emergency procedures within the home and community environments.
* Maintain all required certifications.
* May be required to report to alternate work location (job-coaching can take place anywhere in the community, within 10 miles)
* Report problems and concerns to supervisors immediately
* Perform other duties as assigned by supervisors and/or senior management

**Education/Qualifications**

* High school diploma required, bachelors or masters preferred.
* Experience working with medically fragile people and with people with intellectual/developmental disabilities.
* Valid driver’s license and impeccable driving record.
* Willingness to provide personal care.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.50 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 per week

title: Guidance Counselor -
description:
**Middle School School Guidance Counselor** 

New World Prep Charter School is a K to 8 School located on Staten Island, New York. We serve the Northshore community and have a preference in our lottery for students who come from families whose first language in the home is not English. Our student population is approximately 70% Spanish speaking and 90% plus of our families are considered economically disadvantaged. We believe by providing our Scholars with a quality education in a respectful environment prepares them for high school and beyond and to be able to live choice-filled lives.

**Responsibilities of the Guidance Counselor:**

School-Wide Counseling Focus:

* Provides individual and group counseling services to meet the developmental, preventive, and remedial needs of students both inside and out of the classroom. Each student must be seen at least six times per school year.
* Consult with students, parents, teachers, and other school and community personnel to assist in meeting the needs of students
* Develop curriculum and implement Advisory Program.
* Attendance manager for all students. Support the other guidance counselor with reports regarding students at risk because of poor attendance.
* Assist parents in addressing school-related problems and issues. Refer students and their parents, as needed, to appropriate specialists, special programs and/or outside agencies
* Collaborate with staff in the development of the University Prep Advisory curriculum developing academic, career, personal, social and emotional literacy skills, goals and plans
* Use data to document the results of strategies and interventions that are used to improve student academic performance.
* Facilitate Professional Learning Community Planning Time for Kid Talk Sessions
* If needed to assist in the arrival, breakfast, lunch, in-between class transitions, enrichment, and dismissal, making sure students are always where they are supposed to be and ensuring a professional school culture at these times
* Participate in Student Led Conferences, Back to School NIght, Board Meetings as necessary and other school wide events.
* Perform other related duties as required and assigned.

Staff Support

* Act as a resource to teachers in their instructional practice, especially as it relates to issues of discipline, relationships with students, classroom management, and school culture
* Support teachers to hold all students to high and consistent behavioral expectations that nurture the school’s mission and values.
* Assist with professional development planning and implementation regarding positive student behavior
* Assist teachers, students, and parents in the effective creation and implementation of individual behavior plans
* Proactively circulate throughout classrooms, hallways and other common areas during the day, to gain valuable context on student behavior and help support positive school culture
* Assist with State Exam Preparation and Facilitation
* Assist with arrival and dismissal of Students

**Qualifications:**

**Education and Experience**

* NYS Certification preferred but near completion of a Masters Guidance Program is acceptable.
* Bi lingual – English/ Spanish preferred
* Strong written, grammatical, presentation, and verbal communication skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Outlook
* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and team-oriented

**Personal Qualities and Behavioral Traits**

* Personal qualities of maturity, humility, strong work ethic, sense of humor, and a roll-up-my-sleeves attitude.
* Passionately dedicated to school’s mission with a steadfast belief that all students will receive a rigorous foundation and preparation for the college of their choice at the school.
* Develops and maintains positive communications and working relationships with students, parents, and co-workers by being collaborative and maintaining a pleasant work attitude.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

License/Certification:

* NYS School Counseling Certification (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
**About Us**

Dealer Owned Warranty Company LLC is a leading provider of F&I (Finance and Insurance) partnership services in the automotive industry, offering a full suite of obligor and administrator services, top-of-the-line products, technology, and training. We understand the importance of leveraging process and technology in the F&I industry to drive revenue and ensure success. Our goal is to provide visibility, transparency, and the tools needed for our partners to build their wealth and achieve their goals. DOWC prides itself on taking care of its employees (We were voted one of the “Best Places to Work” two years in a row!), and we also offer award-winning products. **All of our positions are fully on-site in Parsippany, NJ.**

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking an experienced marketing professional to join our growing team in Parsippany! The Marketing Specialist will play a critical role in developing and executing outbound marketing programs that drive lead generation. Key responsibilities include creating content for print and digital efforts, end-to-end email marketing programs, SEO/SEM, Paid Search/Google Campaigns, CRM database management, website updates, project management, and reporting in the company’s marketing team.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

· Create, write, & review content for both print and digital efforts

· Help manage email marketing programs, including list management best practices and segmentation

· Help analyze, review, and implement changes to websites for search engine optimization

· SEM campaign builds, optimizations, & management

· Maintain a customer-focused attitude with a focus on activities that create lifetime customers

· Performs general administrative tasks as needed

· Help with placement of print and digital collateral – including news and feature articles, executive communications, campaigns, events, social media, email, video scripts, and PR.

· Development and implementation of optimized web content across multiple brand properties.

· Help develop social media presence and direct programs to improve social media reputation and recognition

· Work with outside vendors

· Maintain an ongoing list of projects and deadlines in teams

· Assist with daily tasks in support of all marketing department needs

· Assist with any other tasks outlined by the marketing team

**Required skills/Abilities:**

* Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, business, or related course of study
* Minimum of 5-10 years’ experience as a marketing specialist in a corporate environment
* Expertise with database management
* Basic working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite
* Knowledge of SEO/SEM, PPC, Paid Search/Google Campaigns, social media, email marketing, digital advertising, retargeting, CRM, and marketing automation
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Driven and dynamic thinker
* Ability to jump into a fast-paced environment and help with any marketing needs
* Deadline and detail-oriented
* Great time management and organizational skills
* Content and Creative writing interests
* Creative thinking
* Strong desire to learn along with a professional drive
* Solid understanding of different marketing techniques

**Physical Requirements**

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds

**Come join our growing team here in Parsippany! As NJ's Best Places to Work Honoree for two years in a row, we offer:**

* Competitive compensation
* Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k matching, Life Insurance, medical expense card
* PTO and Sick Time
* Corporate events, team and culture building activities, employee awards and recognition, company trips and more!

*DOWC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact us for assistance.*

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: In person

title: Relay Technician
description:
**Requisition**: 77891


**PSEG Company:** PSEG Long Island

**Salary Range**: $ 42.73 - $ 59.96

**Incentive**: Not applicable

**Work Location Category**: Onsite

  

PSEG operates under a Flexible Work Model where flexible work is offered when job requirements allow. In support of this model, roles have been categorized into one of four work location categories: onsite roles, hybrid roles that are a blend of onsite and remote work, remote local roles that are primarily home-based but require some level of purpose-driven in-person interaction and living within a commutable distance, and remote non-local roles that can be effectively performed remotely with the ability to work in approved states.


PSEG offers a unique experience to our more than 12,000 employees – we provide the resources and opportunities for career development that come with being a Fortune 500 company, as well as the attention, camaraderie and care for one another you might typically associate with a small business. Our focus on combatting climate change through clean energy technology, our new net zero climate vision for 2030 and enhanced commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion; and supporting the communities we serve make this a particularly exciting time to join PSEG.


**Union Local**
---------------


IBEW 1049

***Summary***
-------------

**Company Headquarters located in Hicksville, NY.**

 ***Job Duties:***


This classification covers employees engaged in performing the highest type of independent or cooperative work in the skills indicated below. Such employees must be thoroughly familiar with the Company's safety rules and the general rules for operation of PSEG Long Island's electric system as they apply to his work.

* Having a thorough working knowledge of construction, operation and application of all electro-mechanical and solid state electronic relays, including carrier current, audio and r.f. frequency transfer tripping equipment, and the theory of their operation.
* Having a good working knowledge of all types of supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems, load control, metering and telemetering systems involving digital and/or analog principles, techniques and solid-state discrete and integrated circuits.
* Having a good working knowledge of high-speed (4800 bits per sec) digital data transmission principles and servicing techniques on all types of communications channels.
* Having a thorough working knowledge of phase and vector relations for current and voltage and the application of this information in analyzing and interpreting phase angle readings obtained at all types of relays and instruments.
* Calculate single phase and three phase KW, KVAR, KVA and power factors given system voltage, current and phase angle readings.
**Job Duties & Responsibilities**
---------------------------------

***Duties cont'd:***


Lay out and carry through jobs of the quality described below:

* Read and interpret complicated plans, drawings and specifications.
* Must have the ability to diagnose and correct difficulties and faults.
* Must be capable of preparing written reports and sketches.
* Instruct and train lower grade personnel in working methods and safe work practices.
* Working alone or with others, performs the following under the general supervision of relay engineers or supervisors:
* Applying manufacturers' instructions for testing, adjusting and maintaining equipment within his classification.
* Reading and analyzing prints, analyzing and interpreting test results, installing, inspecting, testing, adjusting, maintaining, repairing, checking and correcting wiring, and investigating questionable operations, of all types of relays, instrument transformers, metering equipment, and telemetering equipment, load Control equipment, supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) equipment, and oscillographic equipment with their associated wiring and auxiliary devices.
* Plan and coordinate work with other groups as required.
* Must have the ability to diagnose and correct difficulties and faults, analyze and interpret test results, read and interpret schematic, functional, logic diagrams and wiring prints associated with all the equipment for which the Protection Division has responsibility.
* Must be capable of preparing written reports and sketches.
* Must be able to discriminate as to circuits and equipment required to be cleared in order to safely conduct the work and execute the necessary switching operations in acordance with a duly authorized switching order.
* Having and using a thorough knowledge of the Company's Safety Rules and "General Rules for Operation of Electric Equipment and Lines".
* Must be capable of working on energized equipment without causing interruptions to service.
* Setting, testing, calibrating adjusting and repairing all types of protective relays.
* Perform similar tests as above on all primary system reclosers. These reclosers may be equipped with mechanical, hydraulic, Pneumatic, electrical and electronic control mechanisms.
* Perform all necessary system operational tests to insure proper functional performance of complete protection, control, telemetering, and supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems.
* Perform minor capital installation work from sketches or instructions on protective or control circuits as required to expedite the correction of circuit design deficiencies or to quickly satisfy system control.
**Years of Experience**
-----------------------

**Job Qualifications**
----------------------

* Associates Degree from an accredited college in Electrical Technology or Electronics or honorable discharge with an ET (Electronics Technician rate) from the Military. Applicants will need to provide a copy of their degree and a copy of their official college/military transcript.
* Possession of a valid US driver's license in good standing.
* Must pass a written screening exam.
* The successful candidate will be required to work overtime on an as needed basis and participate in the Emergency Restoration Program.
**Education**
-------------


Associate in Electric Technology**Licenses or Certifications**
------------------------------

* Valid US driver's license
**Training and Courses**
------------------------

* Relay Tech Exam.

title: QC Technician
description:
**SUMMARY** 

Exciting entry level opportunity for a QC Technician in a fast-growing home and personal care products company located in Hauppauge, NY.

The QC Technician is expected to be a team player and to possess excellent work ethics, as well as be able to take initiatives when necessary and carry out all responsibilities in accordance with company policies and core values.

The QC Technician also has a basic understanding or the ability to learn the requirements and regulations in the Pharmaceutical or related industries, such as GMPs/GDPs and routine quality control sampling and testing procedures.

**JOB FUNCTIONS** 

* Operate UPLC systems to analyze active ingredients, ensuring regulatory compliance and meeting quality standards.
* Accurately document raw data and test results on logbooks, perform data analysis, and generate analytical reports.
* Use FTIR to verify chemical structures, ensuring the identity and purity of incoming raw materials.
* Conduct various titration techniques for quantitative chemical analysis, confirming product quality and stability.
* Perform accurate pH measurements and organoleptic evaluation to ensure that in-process samples and finished products meet the required specifications.
* Inspect raw material deliveries, verify receiving documentation, perform sampling for laboratory analysis as needed, and promptly release raw materials in compliance with company requirements and GMP standards.
* Ensure all testing adheres to SOPs, and complies with GMP, GLP, Company policies, and relevant regulatory standards.

**JOB REQUIREMENTS** 

* Analytical Testing: Strong knowledge of pH, chromatography, IR spectra, assay, viscosity, specific gravity, and other chemical testing parameters essential for a quality control environment.
* Lab Equipment Operation: Experience with various laboratory instruments, including UPLC, FTIR, pH meters, and titration systems, ensuring consistent and accurate results.
* Data Analysis & Reporting: Skilled in using software for recording, analyzing, and reporting test results, with a focus on accuracy and clear communication.
* Raw Material Release: Knowledge of the raw material release process, ensuring that all materials meet quality standards and are released in a timely manner to maintain production flow.
* Regulatory Compliance: Familiarity with industry standards such as GMP, GLP, and quality control guidelines, ensuring compliance throughout all QC activities.
* College degree, with a concentration in science, or equivalent experience is preferred.
* 1-2 years of hands-on Quality Assurance / Quality Control experience in a regulated industry environment is preferred (but not required).

**BENEFITS** 

Comprehensive Benefits Package, including Medical, Dental, Vision and 401(k).

Compensation commensurate with relevant experience.

We are an equal opportunity employer. Women, minorities, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

**To apply for the QC Technician position, please forward your resume with contact information to:** 

**Kathy Russell (krussell@precare.com)**

**Premier Care Industries, Inc.** 

**150 Marcus Blvd.** 

**Hauppauge, NY 11788** 

**Tel: 631-667-1055; Fax: 631-667-1087**

title: Registered Nurse, Pediatrics
description:
Registered Nurse (RN) - Home Care Pediatrics

**Job Description**

Prime Home Health Services, LLC. is a comprehensive Brooklyn-based Certified Home Care Agency that has been providing excellent, quality, state of the art care for the last 13 years to clients in our Community. Prime Home Health Services has decided to expand our Agency and has recently launched our Pediatric Home Care Program. We are in need of compassionate, motivated, dedicated Registered Nurses to join our Team. We strive to provide attentive, quality services to our patients. Join our team and find the satisfaction that comes from working with a professional and proactive organization.

As a Pediatric Field Registered Nurse you will be reporting to the Pediatric Patient Care Manager and by utilizing your knowledge and clinical skills will ensure that Prime’s pediatric clients will receive the health care they need and deserve in the comfort and safety of their homes. You will ensure that all home care services are provided in a high quality manner and in accordance with Department of Health regulations; and support the Agency’s mission to provide the highest quality care by complying with regulatory guidelines and meeting agency standards.

**We have immediate needs for Registered Nurses (RN’s) in the following and surrounding areas:**

**Brooklyn, NY**

**Bronx, NY**

**Staten Island, NY**

**Queens, NY**

**New York City, NY**

**Qualifications:**

· Licensed and currently registered under Article 139 (Registered Professional Nurse) in NY State.

· CPR Certification

· Minimum one year clinical experience as a Registered Nurse (RN)

· Minimum one year of Home Care Pediatric Registered Nurse experience

· Must have valid Driver’s License and a Vehicle

· Bi-lingual is a plus!

**Knowledge and Abilities:**

· Able to read, write and speak the English language.

· Client Assessments

· Training and education of family members

· Administration of prescribed medication, treatment and therapy

· Communication with all other members of the client’s multi-disciplinary team

· Supply Management

· Emergency Management

· Proficient computer skills

**Responsibilities**  
- Provide direct patient care in a pediatric setting, including catheterization, IV insertion, and tube feeding.  
- Utilize EMR and EHR systems for accurate documentation and patient care coordination.  
- Conduct patient assessments and implement appropriate nursing interventions.  
- Demonstrate expertise in pediatric physiology and health coaching for children and families.  
- Collaborate with healthcare team members to ensure comprehensive care for pediatric patients.

**Benefits for Registered Nurse (RN)**

· Competitive wages

· Health benefits for full-time employees

· AFLAC for full-time employees

· Paid time off for full-time employees

· Tools needed for your job

title: Specialty Bartender
description:
**This position has an hourly rate of $16 + Tips.**

**SPECIALTY** **BARTENDER****OVERVIEW**

  

In addition to the Bartender responsibilities listed below, the Specialty Bartender will be the main point of service and cocktail preparation in the 15th Floor Club Bar. This role is specific to the 15th floor program and concept. The Specialty Bartender is responsible for shepherding and curating a bespoke experience focused on high quality, rare, and niche spirits and services.

 **BARTENDER OVERVIEW**

  

The Bartender maintains all bar environment and equipment. The Bartender is responsible for ensuring the bar area is clean and tidy. They will proactively assist and drive the guest experience, assist with navigating the menus, wine list, liquor and cocktails, take guests orders, anticipate guests’ needs and address them accordingly.

 **KEY** **RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Available to work and oversee daily bar operations full-time.
* Responsible for mixing drinks, serving drinks, serving food, cleaning bar, setting up and breaking down the bar, following recipes and adhering to DOH standards.
* Submitting daily requisition list to shift beverage manager.
* Daily check, assistance when necessary, and confirmation of barback prep list (syrups and juices)
* Complete a daily inventory based on the request and routine as established by the Director of Bars
* Assist creatively in beverage creation and execution.
* Contribute to bar team and general staff education.
* Enforce consistency in drink execution, presentation, and service.
  

Follow company steps of service including:

* Maintain cleanliness of the bar area at all times, ensure bar area is well stocked with supplies and beverages including:
* Clean and organized bar area continuously; restock bar with clean glasses.
* Clean counters, floors, shelves, and refrigerators; remove trash.
* Check coolers and shelves to ensure proper stocking of beer, wine, liquor,

and all beverages; stock bar with ice as needed.

* Check for supplies such as sugar, salt, stir sticks, straws, napkins as per

specified inside work list.

* Requisition of additional supplies as needed.
* Cut fruit and garnishes; retrieve special garnishes from kitchen.
* Assist, when necessary, in preparation of coffee and tea.
* Oversee and assist barback in the preparation of syrups and juices.
* Greet and serve all guests who may be seated at tables, as well as the bar on the 15th floor in a friendly and courteous manner and explain, as necessary, any specials and/or bar promotions.
* Record the details of the order from guests, repeating as necessary, to check for accuracy.
* Prepare drinks in accordance with the guest’s order.
* Replenish beverages as necessary and check with guests for overall satisfaction.
* Present an accurate check to the guest when asked, collect and process payment.
* Keep track of guest alcohol consumption in accordance with New York State Liquor Laws and ensure that all alcohol is appropriately accounted for and stored.
* Receive, open, maintain, and close bar bank at end of shift.
* Handle, process and settle all cash payment and transactions from bar and lounge.
* At the end of the shift deliver all checks and reports to the appropriate manager according to company rules.
* Anticipate guest needs, as to where guests will never have to ask for anything.
* Wish every guest a warm farewell and thank them for coming.
* All other responsibilities assigned by management.
  

Additional Duties and Responsibilities

* Report all suspicious persons or activities and hazardous or unsafe conditions to management.
* Provide excellent service at all times to all of our guests. Assist guests courteously and efficiently.
* Respond to all guest questions. Provide guest assistance, direction, and information as requested when working in public areas.
* Extensive knowledge of food and beverage to best service and up sell our product, including liquors and cocktails.
* Assist any Bar and Lobby Lounge cocktail server in lounge when necessary.
* Attend all food and beverage training classes.
* Follow the posted opening and closing duties and side work sheet.
* Attend daily pre meal and communication meeting.
* Attend monthly department meeting.
* Generate a positive, nurturing, and teaching work culture striving for excellence.
 **REQUIRED** **EXPERIENCE** **AND QUALIFICATIONS**

* 5 years’ experience in a luxury hotel environment or similar stand-alone restaurant or bar setting
* Positive, engaging, and energetic personality.
* Able to be organized, manage time wisely and work with little to no direct supervision.
* Very high attention to detail
* Sensitive to cultural nuances
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal on English
* Able to handle a multitude of tasks in an intense, fast paced environment.
* Excellent people skills and the ability to work under pressure and with various stakeholders.
* Ability to maintain a clean and professional appearance as per company policies.
* Ability to stand for extended periods of time.
* Ability to carry, push, and pull heavy loads up to 30 lbs; standing, bending and lifting will be required.
* Multi-lingual is a plus.

INDFOH

title: General Manager
description:
**Company Profile:**  

At CAVA, we make it deliciously simple to eat well and feel good every day. We are guided by a Mediterranean heritage that’s been perfecting how to eat and live for four thousand years. We prioritize authenticity, curiosity and the pursuit of excellence in everything we do. We are working towards something big, together.  

  

**We foster a culture built on five core values:**

* **Generosity First****,** **Always****:** We lead with kindness. Our best work happens when we act in service of others.
* **Constant Curiosity:** We are eager to learn, grow, and explore beyond the obvious.
* **Act with Agility:** We welcome change; it’s the only constant. We embrace, adjust, adapt.
* **Passion for Positivity:** We greet each day with warmth and possibility.
* **Collective Ambition:** We have high aspirations that are achieved when we work together with a shared purpose.
 **General Manager:** Managers will oversee all restaurant operations and team members. Managers provide leadership and motivation to ensure that all team members are guest-focused and team-focused. Managers set high standards and establish a positive work atmosphere for their team to create successful day-to-day operations.

 **What** **You’ll** **Bring to the Table:**

* Develop yourself and others – focus on self-improvement while supporting the success of others
* Lead your four-wall operation like you own it – from people development, to inventory, labor, staffing, and accountability
* Put the customer first – including your internal customers, your team. You will be responsible for regular people planning, coaching, training, accountability, and when necessary, corrective action
* Consistently create CAVA fanatics – find ways to say “yes” to every guest, inspiring your teams to do the same
* Achieve results – take ownership of every shift and take pride in your job
* Foster collaboration – work with others to find success as a group
* Adapt to change – solve problems through an open-minded and all-inclusive approach
* Assist with any additional duties assigned
 **What We Bring to the Table (Benefits):**  

We’ve got you covered. Here are just some of the benefits available to CAVA team members:

* Competitive pay $
* Early Wage Access\\*
* Health, Dental, Vision, Telemedicine, Pet Insurance plus more!\\*
* 401k enrollment with CAVA contribution\\*
* Paid sick leave, parental leave, and community service leave\\*
* FREE CAVA Meal for every shift worked (YEP, that’s right, FREE CAVA!)
* The opportunity to be on the ground floor of a rapidly growing brand
  

  

* indicates eligible qualifying positions
 **Physical Requirements:**

* Must be able to bend and reach overhead often
* Must possess dexterity to handle tongs, pots/pans, and other equipment
* Must be comfortable working in temperatures ranging from hot to cold
* Must be comfortable working near open flames
* May be required to work in tight spaces
* Must maintain near constant communication with multiple people
* Close vision, distance vision, and peripheral vision are required
* Must be able to sit, squat and kneel occasionally
* Must be able to work in a constant state of alertness and safe manner
* May be required to occasionally work in outdoor weather conditions
* May stand for long periods of time and lift up to 50 pounds
  

As an equal opportunity employer, CAVA considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, age, height, weight, marital status, sexual orientation, familial status, genetic information or any other characteristic or protected classes as defined by federal, state, or local law.
