title: Contract Marketing Manager, SEO and Web Experiences
description:
**About Foursquare**



Foursquare is the leading independent location technology and data cloud platform, dedicated to building meaningful bridges between digital spaces and physical places. Our proprietary technology unlocks the most accurate, trustworthy location data in the world, empowering businesses to answer key questions, uncover hidden insights, improve customer experiences, and achieve better business outcomes. A pioneer of the geo-location space, Foursquare's location tech stack is being utilized by our mobile apps CityGuide and Swarm, as well as the world's largest enterprises and most recognizable brands, like Amazon, Microsoft, Samsung, Spotify, Uber, Airbnb and others.



Foursquare's flexible building blocks include technology to maximize marketing impact and drive incremental real-world engagement (Attribution, Audience, Proximity, SDK); data to deeply understand points of interest and real-world behavior patterns (Places and Visits), and tools to conduct advanced analysis, data enrichment, unification and visualization (Studio).


**About the Marketing Operations Team:**



The Marketing Operations team at Foursquare is responsible for our digital web experience, marketing tech and funnel optimization, and marketing reporting and analytics to drive campaign and funnel effectiveness. As a team we are the strategists, architects, designers, developers, producers and testers who create and optimize to reduce barriers in the journey for our prospects and customers. Our ambition is to deliver best in-class experiences on the web and mobile to support customer growth, retention and engagement for our enterprise, developer, and marketer clients.


**About The Role:**



Foursquare is looking for a Part-Time Contract Marketing Manager, SEO and Web Experiences to join our team and be responsible for the ongoing testing, optimization and personalization roadmap across Foursquare websites.



To excel in this position, you'll need to craft a robust test-and-learn strategy, prioritizing conversion rate optimization (CRO) to enhance website features and content for both short-term gains and long-term growth.



Reporting to the Director of Marketing Analytics, Operations, and Web Experiences, you'll collaborate closely with various teams—from Product to Creative—to drive projects outlined in our Foursquare.com roadmap. Your role demands a blend of strategic insight and hands-on execution, with a keen ability to pivot between the two. As the lead for website content and optimization, you'll spearhead and execute on project strategy, development, and management efforts.



Your collaboration with product, marketing, and strategy teams will ensure Foursquare delivers exceptional experiences to prospects and customers alike.



The ideal candidate is a self-starter, meticulously analytical, and thrives in a data-driven environment. Experience in fast-paced, high-tech settings, coupled with a passion for supporting a diverse client base, is advantageous. If you're driven by curiosity and perpetually seek opportunities to enhance digital experiences, we'd love to connect with you.


**What You'll Do:**


* Lead technical SEO initiatives, focusing on improving website rankings, traffic, and organic performance.
* Develop and implement data-driven strategies to optimize Foursquare's business website across multiple products, driving improvements in key SEO and website metrics.
* Conduct site architecture optimization, improving URL hierarchy, internal linking, and crawlability.
* Own the governance and management of web content, ensuring alignment with SEO best practices and UX principles.
* Collaborate closely with Product, Creative, and Marketing teams to execute site enhancements for campaigns, product launches, and always-on programs.
* Analyze customer journeys, performing page speed optimization and ensuring Core Web Vitals are met.
* Create personalized experiences using Mutiny to target key accounts and audiences with relevant content that increases user value and engagement.
* Assist with website redesign efforts, including Wordpress page creation from templates, content strategy, conversion optimization, and more.
* Have a deep understanding of our business, needs, expectations, requirements, and of digital experience testing methodologies (A/B, multivariate, etc.)
* Ensure that stakeholder and leadership signoff is obtained at key points during projects, and communicate project status daily, weekly and monthly during key business reviews


**How You'll Measure Success:**


* Track and report key SEO metrics such as traffic, keyword rankings, and conversion rates.
* Execute A/B testing to optimize lead generation and conversions across the website.
* Drive online form conversions, monitoring our performance against competitors.
* Demonstrate tangible improvements in website traffic, user engagement, and overall SEO performance.


**What You'll Need:**


* A passion for improving the customer experience through innovative web design and SEO strategies.
* Expertise in managing a B2B brand's website with a track record of improving keyword rankings and user experience to meet business goals.
* Strong knowledge of technical SEO, including structured data, crawling, and log file analysis.
* Mastery of Wordpress website and SEO management
* Advanced skills in Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Tag Manager, Hotjar, and SEMRush
* Proficiency with Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Slides) for reporting, analysis, and collaboration.
* A solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with the ability to collaborate effectively with developers on website enhancements.
* Experience in site architecture optimization and Core Web Vitals improvements.
* The ability to balance short-term wins with long-term strategic growth.
* Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, especially in working closely with Product, Creative, and Marketing teams.
* A self-starter with a data-driven mindset, continuously striving to drive improvement and change, while owning and leading SEO and website strategy.
* Knowledge and direct experience working with leading digital experience tech platforms:
+ Experimentation platforms (e.g. Optimizely, Mutiny, Adobe Test & Target)
+ CMS and/or web-tech platforms (e.g. HubSpot, Marketo, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, etc)

* Passion for Foursquare and its mission of building the world's best location platform
* *Your own unique talents! If you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, we encourage and welcome you to still apply!*


**Benefits and Perks**


* **Flexible PTO** - rest and recharge when you need it!
* **Equipment Setup** - you will receive all necessary hardware for your job function
* **Employee Resource Groups** - to help you stay connected
* **Hybrid Work Schedule** for in-person collaboration on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. For roles considered remote, this will not apply.


**At Foursquare, we are committed to providing competitive pay that is in line with industry and market standards. Actual compensation packages are based on a wide array of factors unique to each candidate including but not limited to skill set, years & depth of experience, and specific office location.**



For this position, the total cash compensation range is **$40-60 USD per hour.** However,actual salaries can vary based on a candidate's qualifications, skills and competencies, as well as location.

  


***Things to know…***


*Foursquare is proud to foster an inclusive environment that is free from discrimination. We strongly believe in order to build the best products, we need a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds. This leads to a more delightful experience for our users and team members. We value listening to every voice and we encourage everyone to come be a part of building a company and products we love.*


*Foursquare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*


**Foursquare Privacy Policy**

title: Planning Manager
description:
**Looking for a job to get you out of bed?**
--------------------------------------------



The Business Planning Manager will report to the VP of Financial Planning & Analysis and will oversee planning & forecasting for Casper's eCommerce, Retail Store, and Wholesale channels. They will partner closely with the respective channel leaders to maximize sales and profitability. The Business Planning Manager will be instrumental in budgeting, forecasting, and reporting on all business lines. They will be responsible for facilitating the growth of our owned channels by helping to develop profitable revenue targets that align with the Company's goals. They will develop and implement tools that provide planning infrastructure, process, and reporting to the channel leaders for scale.



Casper (Casper.com) believes everyone should sleep better. The Sleep Company has a full portfolio of obsessively engineered sleep products—including mattresses, pillows, bedding, and furniture—designed in-house by the Company's award-winning R&D team at Casper Labs. In addition to its e-commerce business, Casper owns and operates Sleep Shops across the United States and its products are available at a growing list of retailers.



We are deeply committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce so that we represent all those who dream big equally.


**When you're not catching zzz's, this is what you'll do…**
-----------------------------------------------------------


* Develop the annual revenue budget by month at location / product level
* Own monthly revenue reforecast by working closely with channel leaders, Operations, and Finance to accurately forecast revenue, promotional cadence, and channel margin down to product level
* Partner with the Operations team by providing accurate revenue forecasts to ensure channel inventory needs are met
* Propose and establish pricing for existing and new product lines across eCommerce, Retail Stores, and Wholesale partners
* Monitor and perform margin analysis on all existing products and potential promotional opportunities
* Analyze potential new product launches to identify risks and opportunities to help the business achieve topline and margin goals
* Develop hindsight reporting by season including final product selling, classification selling, SKU counts, and price bands
* Partner with channels to develop assortment strategies by channel and geo to further drive opportunity
* Drive deep dive product analysis by channel to support future business strategy
* Standardize weekly/monthly business reporting for sell through results for both product and location selling
* Manage and develop a team of three

**Our dream candidate has…**
----------------------------


* Bachelor's Degree
* 6+ years retail planning experience with a global brand
* Experience managing and mentoring direct reports
* Ability to balance analytics with product and market trends
* Advanced skills in retail math; sales, gross margin, return on investment (ROI), weeks of supply (WOS), turn, etc. and how to impact them
* Expert Excel skills, experience with planning tools, JD Edwards, or Adaptive are a plus
* Ability to build and maintain positive and productive relationships with peers and cross-functional teams
* Manages multiple projects while prioritizing and meeting deadlines
* Able to present business strategies and action plans to all levels of management

**The syrup on your waffles…**
------------------------------



Targeted Annual Base Salary Range for NYC: $118,000-135,000



Casper's compensation philosophy ensures that the actual base salary is based on factors including but not limited to skills, education, experience, special training, time in position, and/or years of service.



We recognize that annual base salary is just one part of a total rewards package. In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, wellbeing resources, and other perks including:


* Participation in our HQ bonus program for some splurging.
* Medical, vision, and dental insurance to help you with those coughs or cavities (too many waffles)
* Unlimited vacation policy. We believe in the power of rest so take the time you need to recharge.
* Work from Anywhere program where you can work anywhere around the world for up to 4 weeks per year
* A full gifted bed set when you join and product discounts for friends and family!
* … and more!


If you dream about this stuff this job is probably right for you. We look forward to learning more.

title: Grocery Field Merchandiser (ISE Team)
description:
**Company Overview**  

General Trading is a grocery wholesale food distributor located in **Carlstadt, New Jersey**. The company services Parade, Life Goods, and Life Everyday labels along with most major US brand grocery products to over 3,000 independently owned supermarkets throughout the metropolitan NY area and surrounding states. It was incorporated over 80 years ago and has grown and expanded to provide our retail partners with a diverse variety of over 12,000 grocery and dairy items. General Trading not only is committed to supporting the well-being our local community but also supplies food to many countries around the globe.


General Trading Co., Inc. and its subsidiaries consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. General Trading is an equal opportunity employer.

**Description:** General Trading is looking for experienced **Field Merchandisers** to service customers in Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, and the Bronx. The role is responsible for promoting the sale of goods for proper item representation in assigned accounts. Resets, re-labeling shelves and/or setting up new and transitioned accounts will need to be done routinely, timely and accurately. Regional travel around the NYC tri-state area is required.

**Job Type:** Full time - Monday through Friday.

**Location:** Metropolitan Area

**Salary:** $15 - $20 per hour, based on experience

**Functions:**

* Connecting to customer accounts using a custom and simple phone App
* Identify needs for additional products to optimize sales and performing assigned tasks
* Take before and after pictures
* Customer Service and Communication
* Lifting and bending to Clean & Set Category

**Requirements:**

* High school diploma
* 3 years experience in Food Retail
* Smartphone

**Benefits:**

* Full Healthcare-benefits Package
* 401K with 6% company match
* Sick, Personal and Vacation Days


.

title: Assistant Experience Manager
description:
**About Sloomoo Institute**

Sloomoo Institute is a rapidly growing interactive experience based on play, #satisfying through handmade slime, tapping into the senses, and ASMR. We are an art-inspired, immersive haven of color, design, and joy. Launched in 2019, Sloomoo Institute now has 4 locations and has been an enormous success, attracting over 1 million guests and billions of media impressions. A fifth flagship will be opening in LA in the late summer/early fall. Even more, slime play is known to support stress relief as much as it does your imagination! Driven by a mission to provide a reprieve from the chaos of the world and screen addiction, the brand has close ties to mental health non-profits and a dedication to inclusion as well as supporting neurodiversity through our experience and our workforce.

**Position Summary**

The Assistant Experience Manager working in conjunction with the Experience Manager will play a lead role in the daily operation and management of Sloomoo Institute, creating an inclusive culture and a warm welcome for our guests, volunteers and staff. The Experience Manager will be confident in managing people, projects and budgets, and will know when to delegate and when to take ownership. They will bring a positive and empowering attitude to the team, and their motivating approach will ensure a high standard of delivery across the site. They will be able to work with a range of different stakeholders and demonstrate flexibility and a proactive and diplomatic approach to problem-solving.

**Responsibilities:**

* When the Experience Manager is off site, the Assistant Experience Manager assumes overall leadership of the guest experience, line management of the Attraction team, and responsibility for creating an exceptional experience for all guests.
* Take personal responsibility for presentation and experience standards across the site.
* Support the Experience Manager with the strategic development of guest operations, including future resourcing priorities for admissions and the permanent and flexible seasonal staffing teams.
* Continually support and challenge the teams to maintain and improve the overall experience, championing developments that have a positive impact on the visit.
* Develop and maintain excellent working relationships with relevant leadership teams.
* Champion all requirements relating to accessibility including physical facilities and staff training, and delivery and improvements across the site.
* Experience with creating and managing shift schedules and scheduling software
* Work closely with the marketing team to deliver local strategies and ensure that they are in line with the Sloomoo Brand.
* Support the Experience Manager to maximize guest admissions income and support the senior management team, with future forecasts and budgets.
* In conjunction with the Experience Manager control Attraction/Front of House Labor spend to ensure we are achieving budgets.
* Work closely with the Production team to support the needs of all guests.
* Support marketing efforts through videos, pictures, stories etc.
* Promptly responds to all changes and challenges and ensuring decisions are made with optimal guest/employee experience in mind.
* A team environment where slime tenders are cross-trained and able to lead any station.
* Consistent quality of team members
* Consistent schedule among team members resulting in retention levels of 70%+
* Respond promptly and effectively to changes and challenges, prioritizing optimal guest and employee experiences.
* Foster a cross-trained, versatile team environment.
* Exceptional Guest satisfaction (NPS of ≥80%), and positive guest reviews (≥4.5 stars).
* Achieve retail sales targets (avg. $15/guest) and maintain appropriate staffing levels.
* Maintaining appropriate staffing levels that meets head count and budgetary expectations
* Other duties as assigned

**Qualifications:**

* 3+ years of experience of operational management within a guest-facing operation (essential) including hotels, restaurant/food & beverage, entertainment operations, museums, live events, cruise lines, or similar.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills
* Excellent communication skills and a friendly and approachable manner with staff from across the organization, ensuring good working relationships.
* Ability to engage with colleagues in a diplomatic manner, with firmness where necessary.
* Energetic, perceptive, confident problem solver with a good sense of humor
* This position requires prolonged periods of standing, walking, repetitive motions, arm waving, bending, kneeling and climbing, at times while wearing a costume or uniform.
* Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Office, Google Suite, Slack, Project Management Systems (Asana or similar).

**Inclusivity Commitment:**

Sloomoo Institute is a company that respects and welcomes the uniqueness of each employee and offers everyone the means to find their place and thrive. We are committed to equal employment opportunities, career development opportunities and promoting initiatives aimed at creating a culture that is meaningful, innovative and successful. Sloomoo Institute does not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with neurodiversity or a disability or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Job Type: Full-time

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching

* Health insurance

* Vision insurance

title: Executive Administrative Assistant
description:
Expanding Westchester based luxury home service company seeks an Executive Administrative Assistant to assist in our sales/marketing, and finance departments. We are looking for a self-starter, who is organized, outgoing, motivated, and interested in building their career. This candidate will train amongst the best in the business to provide white glove service to upscale clients. This candidate will possess a positive and professional demeanor, enjoy client interaction, and be committed to personal development. ***This is an in office position 7:45am-5:00pm***

**Duties:**

* Answer incoming phone calls promptly and professionally.
* Call clients to confirm appointments and schedule as necessary.
* Update the CRM system for each interaction.
* Regularly review and monitor progress against goals and seek assistance as needed.
* Calendar Scheduling
* Prepare correspondences
* Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Overseeing the day-to-day operations of the office, including managing staff calendars; maintaining office supplies; processing mail.
* The ideal candidate must be a self-starter, demonstrate excellent follow-up and writing skills, and interact seamlessly and professionally

**Qualifications:**

* College degree preferred
* Minimum 10 years of experience as an Executive Assistant in a fast-paced environment
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word) applications
* Communicate effectively both verbally and written
* Excellent attention to detail, including strong proofreading skills.
* Good communication skills and presentation

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

title: Help Desk Technician
description:
* Helpdesk Supervisor shall have at least three (3) years of experience working in a help desk environment as a helpdesk technician/analyst.
* Supervise the daily operations of the helpdesk, ensuring the delivery of high-quality technical assistance to end users.
* Coordinate call taking, triage, and dispatching activities to ensure timely resolution of issues.
* Provide telephone support and screening, effectively determining the nature of problems and escalating them as required.
* Oversee level 1 remediation activities and escalate calls for desk side/server side resolution.
* Utilize the InContact ACD system to interface with the FDNY phone system, directing, queuing, presenting, and recording calls in the order of receipt.
* Configure and maintain the ACD system, including setting up welcome messages, menu options, call prioritization, call back functionality, and off-site access during emergencies.
* Ensure fault tolerance and monitor call metrics and reporting for performance evaluation and process improvement.
* Update and maintain current client lists, personnel lists, personnel folders, master codes, data entry, and product identification information
* Manage and lead a team of helpdesk personnel, providing guidance, coaching, and training as needed.

Foster a positive and collaborative work environment, promoting teamwork and excellent customer service

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

title: Case Manager, Brownsville Homebase
Medical Assistant | Part Time
description:
**Medical Assistant**

  

Locations: New York, Long Island (Mineola, Hicksville)
Schedule: Monday - Saturday, 8 hours - 12 hours (rotating weekends)  

Pay Range: $17 - $27/hour depending on experience and qualifications.**About the Company**
=====================


At Nao Medical, we're revolutionizing healthcare by blending cutting-edge technology with heartfelt, personalized care. Over the past 13 years, we've proudly served more than a million New Yorkers at our various locations. Our mission is simple: through our multi-specialty practice, we provide accessible, quality care tailored to each patient's needs. We're breaking down barriers, championing health equity, and delivering value-based care to create healthier communities.**Job Summary**
===============


As a Medical Assistant, you will play a vital part in our clinics by providing essential support through a combination of clinical and administrative duties. You will be assisting physicians in patient care, performing various medical procedures, and efficiently managing administrative tasks, thereby enhancing the overall efficiency and quality of healthcare delivery. As a Medical Assistant, you are expected to be cross-trained as a patient care/front desk assistant to provide the best customer care service.**Primary Responsibilities**
============================

* You will undertake a range of clinical tasks, including taking patient vital signs, assisting with medical procedures, and collecting/preparing lab specimens.
* Providing exceptional customer service will be a priority, ensuring prompt and compassionate responses to patient inquiries and concerns.
* Efficiently managing front desk tasks, such as patient registration, insurance verification, and appointment scheduling, will be part of your responsibilities as needed.
* Adherence to clinic rules, company policies, and brand standards will be essential to maintain compliance and uphold professional standards.
* Collaboration with the team will be crucial to deliver timely and outstanding patient care. Embracing personal and professional growth, you will learn from teammates, customers, and managers to continuously improve your skills and knowledge.

**Job Requirements**
====================

**Education and Experience:**
-----------------------------

* High school diploma or Associate degree holder.
* Completion of an accredited medical assisting program (CMA/RMA) is preferred but not required.
* Certification in Basic Life Support (BLS), Phlebotomy, and EKG (Electrocardiogram).
* Proficient knowledge of HIPAA regulations, medical terminology, anatomy, and basic clinical procedures.
* Preferred but not required: bilingual skills in Spanish and English, experience in using electronic medical records (EMR) systems.
* Tech-savvy, customer service-oriented medical assistant with strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Open-minded and adaptable - willing to utilize their skills in various areas to support the entire team.
* Empathetic and patient - capable of effectively handling diverse personalities and situations that patients may encounter.

**Schedule Requirements:**
--------------------------

* Ability to work Monday to Saturday, 8 hours - 12 hours duty shifts, rotating weekends

**Benefits (Full-Time):**
=========================

* Medical, Dental, Vision, Basic Life, and Short-Term Disability Insurance options for you and your dependents
* Paid Family and Disability Leave\\*
* FMLA\\*
* 401K Retirement Plan\\*
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Free care for you and discounted care for your family at all Nao Medical locations
* Nurturing a passion for promoting a healthier community and opportunities for leadership and career growth

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**
==========================================

  

Nao Medical is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all employment terms and conditions, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.  

Nao Medical is dedicated to providing a work environment free from discrimination and harassment and treating all individuals with respect and dignity. Combining individuals from diverse backgrounds and experiences creates a more innovative, creative, and productive workforce. ***Experience the Nao Medical difference. Join us in transforming healthcare, Nao!***
company_description: Nao Medical is a tech-enabled, multi-specialty practice providing quality healthcare across more than 12 locations in the NY Metro area.

title: Office Administrator
description:
This position provides administrative support to the branch manager and sales associates with emphasis on marketing and social media, oversees and performs office operation duties, , interprets and enforces company policy and provides customer service. Duties may vary depending on the size of the real estate sales office.


**Job Duties and Responsibilities** *(Essential Job Functions)* *Common job activities are listed below; actual position responsibilities may vary. Refer to your manager or human resources for specific duties and performance expectations.*



* Direct and coordinate the administrative activities in support of the real estate office. Oversee, maintain and perform the day-to-day sales office operations, including: payment of bills, answering phones, record keeping, invoicing, marketing, filing, assisting sales/branch manager, tracking expenses, greeting clients, building and equipment maintenance and maintenance of office supply and marketing material inventories. (40-50%)


* Oversee the processing and verifying of new listings and sales, which may include entering the listings and sales into the system. May handle correspondence, mail and support appointment setting. (20-30%)


* Provide support to the sales associates which may include, processing license applications for new, renewing and transferring sales associates, ensuring all paperwork is completed and processed in a timely manner, conducting orientation for new sales associates, assisting sales associates with billings, advertising, paperwork and training. Remain available and act as the first point of contact for sales associates. (15-20%)


* Coordinate special events, collateral material, flyers, handouts and brochures. (0-5%)


* Provide telecommunication support, including notice of phone number changes, coordinate long distance codes with long distance carrier as needed; assign voice mail and DID numbers for new agents; maintain voice mail computer system adding and deleting agents as required. (0-5%)


* Perform any additional responsibilities as requested or assigned. (0 – 5%)



**Performance Expectations**


* Meet all performance and behavior expectations outlined in the company performance appraisal form or communicated by management.
* Perform responsibilities as directed achieving desired results within expected time frames and with a high degree of quality and professionalism.
* Establish and maintain positive and productive work relationships with all staff, customers and business partners.
* Demonstrate the behavioral and technical competencies necessary to effectively complete job responsibilities. Take personal initiative for technical and professional development.
* Follow the company HR Policy, the Code of Business Conduct and all subsidiary and department policies and procedures, including protecting confidential company information, attending work punctually and regularly, and following good safety practices in all activities.


**Qualifications**



Education:


* Bachelor’s degree in business administration or related field; or equivalent work experience and knowledge.


*Experience:*


* Three to five plus years of related experience and demonstrated supervisory skills.


*Knowledge and Skills:*


* Knowledge of real estate, title and /or mortgage business strongly preferred.
* Strong computer skills; proficient in Microsoft Office products, including Word, Excel, Publisher.
* Working knowledge of major social media platforms such as Instagram and Facebook,
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Effective interpersonal skills and leadership abilities. A strong customer-service focus.
* Effective analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills; initiative, attention to detail, and a team player.
* Project management skills; ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks and projects concurrently.
* Ability to handle stress and work under pressure.
* Ability to work evenings and weekends.


*Other (licenses, certifications, schedule flexibility/OT, travel, etc.):*


* Real estate license preferred.


We offer a full suite of benefits including Medical, Health Savings Account, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Paid Vacation (PTO), 401(k) with employer match, Flexible Spending Account, and Employee Assistance Program (EAP)


***Equal Opportunity Employer***

title: Bilingual Human Resources Manager
description:
If you’re looking to spread your wings and join a team where you can share your HR expertise as a team of one, guide employees and managers, drive HR initiatives, bring new ideas to the table, and get exposure to all areas of HR, we want to talk to you! **Reed-Lane** is seeking a **bilingual HR Manager** (English/Spanish) to join our team in **Wayne, NJ**.

Our office staff is onsite 100% of the time at our Wayne, NJ location to support the production environment and their day-to-day efforts.

**What you’ll do**

As a team of one, you’ll own all HR functions while collaborating with finance and other department managers to understand our employees and help inform decisions and policies using that understanding to drive the best outcomes. Although every day in HR is a little different, day-to-day you’ll:

* Manage full-cycle recruitment for plant and office personnel
* Suggest, collaborate with the leadership team, and implement HR initiatives as needed
* Administer paperwork and track all requests for FMLA, ADA, and NJ state disability
* Keep current on local, state, and federal laws and regulations
* Handle benefits administration and assist with open enrollment and insurance negotiations
* Maintain relationships with insurance brokers and other HR-related vendors
* Coordinate training schedules for new hires to ensure mandatory trainings are completed
* Create and update all HR SOP’s
* Assist managers with employee complaints/write-ups/terminations, providing support as needed
* Drive the performance management process, guiding managers and answering questions

**What you need to thrive in this role** 

* Bilingual in English and Spanish, both verbal and written, required
* 2+ years of HR Generalist experience, meaning general knowledge of hiring, benefits, FMLA/ADA/State disability, federal and state laws, and employee complaints and investigations
* Associate degree, bachelor’s degree, or HR certification, preferred
* Good communication skills, confidentiality, and the ability to remain neutral
* Detail-oriented, organization, and time management skills

**About us**

Headquartered in Wayne, NJ, Reed-Lane is a pharmaceutical contract packager who has been providing innovative packaging solutions to pharmaceutical companies since 1959. We aren’t making the pharmaceuticals but rather supporting our pharmaceutical partners with their packaging needs. Because we are a privately held company, Reed-Lane serves the complex, ever-changing needs of its customers with great speed and agility. Our team-focused culture begins at the top and is evident throughout the company. The teamwork and open communication allow us to exceed both regulatory requirements and our customers’ high expectations of quality, timeliness, and professionalism. Reed-Lane’s team focus has resulted in many of our employees staying with Reed-Lane much longer than the industry average. They possess an in-depth familiarity with every aspect of the contract packaging process. If you’d like to learn more, visit our website: https://reedlane.com/

**What we offer you**

We care about our employee's well-being:

* Medical and dental insurance
* Company-paid life insurance
* Company-paid long-term disability insurance
* Paid time off
* Holidays
* 401k with company match
* Discretionary company-wide bonuses as profitability allows

**I’m interested, how do I get started?**

Apply to: https://app.jobvite.com/j?aj=odx7tfw4&s=Indeed

Is this the job for you? If not, feel free to share this link with someone who might be interested.

Our hiring management partner is myHR Partner. myHR Partner is not a staffing service or recruiter. All resumes/applications will be reviewed for this position and only for our organization.

Thank you for considering us as a potential employer!

At Reed-Lane, we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal-opportunity employer, we stay true to that by ensuring that our place can be anyone’s place.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What is your desired salary range?
* To best serve our employees, our HR Manager needs to be bilingual in English/Spanish. Are you able to read, write, and speak both?
* While not required for the role, do you have a SHRM certification or experience utilizing SHRM as a resource?

Ability to Commute:

* Wayne, NJ 07470 (Required)

title: Fitness Programming and Education Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
**About Us:**  
FIT Franchise Brands is the franchisor behind two of the most dynamic fitness concepts in the industry: THE MAX Challenge and Farrell's eXtreme Bodyshaping. Our mission is to help people live healthier, happier lives through fitness, nutrition, and community support. We are seeking a dedicated and experienced fitness professional to join our team as a part-time Fitness Programming and Education Specialist.

**Position Overview:**  
As a Fitness Programming and Education Specialist, you will contribute to the ongoing development and refinement of our fitness programming. You will be responsible for assisting with class programming, testing new fitness equipment, supporting instructor trainings, and serving as a fitness resource within our corporate office. This role requires a passion for fitness and education, as well as the flexibility to work in a part-time capacity.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Program Support:** Assist in the development and refinement of class programming that aligns with the unique value propositions of both THE MAX Challenge and Farrell's eXtreme Bodyshaping.
* **Equipment Testing:** Participate in the testing and evaluation of new fitness equipment, providing feedback and recommendations for implementation.
* **Instructor Support:** Assist with instructor training sessions and boot camps to ensure high-quality delivery of our programs across all locations.
* **Resource Development:** Create and update training materials and resources to support franchisees and their teams.
* **Collaboration:** Work with the corporate fitness team to ensure programming is effectively communicated and delivered.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Exercise Science, Kinesiology, or a related field, or equivalent experience. Fitness certifications are a plus.
* 2+ years of experience in fitness program development or instructor training.
* Strong understanding of current fitness trends, equipment, and training methodologies.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

**Compensation:**

* **Hourly Rate:** $30 - $40 per hour, depending on experience and qualifications.
* **Hours:** Approximately 20-25 hours per week, with flexibility for additional hours as needed. Occasional Saturdays for trainings - Approximately 4-8x annually.
* **Benefits:** Access to company fitness facilities, professional development opportunities, and a flexible work schedule.

**Why Join Us?**

* Be part of a team dedicated to transforming lives through fitness.
* Play a key role in shaping the future of two leading fitness brands.
* Enjoy a flexible, part-time role with opportunities for growth and development.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $30.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 25 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Gym membership
* Health insurance
* Opportunities for advancement
* Professional development assistance

* Weekends as needed

* Performance bonus

title: Clinic Administrative Assistant
description:
**RiseWell Community Servies is seeking a Full Time Administrative Assistant to join our team. The ideal candidate will provide support to ensure efficient operation of the office. Provide ongoing administrative support to Clinic program and staff. Oversee the maintenance of client documentation needed for enrollment in program.**

**REPORTS TO:** Program Supervisor  
**DEPARTMENT:** Clinical Services

**QUALIFICATIONS:**   
High school diploma and 1 year administrative experience. A valid and clean NY State driver license,fingerprinting, criminal record check, and approval from NYS Office of Mental Health.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Answer, screen and direct telephone calls
* Schedule appointments for Clinic, make reminder phone calls for next day’s appointments and check insurance eligibility as needed.

Founded in 1972, RiseWell Community Services (RiseWell) is an innovative, multi-service, community-based social wellness agency. title: Behavior Technician - Afternoon Hours
description:
**Location:** In home in Rutherford, NJ

**Hours:** Variable and depend on case assignment, most cases are in the afternoons with about 20 hours per week, weekends may be available if desired.

**About Stepping Stones ABA:**  
Stepping Stones ABA is a leading provider of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy services for individuals with autism and related developmental disorders in the NJ area. We are committed to improving the lives of our clients and their families by delivering high-quality, evidence-based ABA therapy. We are a people first company and strive to maintain a positive and encouraging culture for all!

**Job Description:**  
We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) to join our team at Stepping Stones ABA. As a Behavior Assistant/ RBT, you will play a crucial role in providing one-on-one ABA therapy to individuals with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and other developmental disorders. Your primary responsibility will be to implement behavior intervention plans developed by Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) and contribute to the overall progress and development of our clients.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Direct Client Support:** Provide one-on-one ABA therapy to clients in various settings, including homes, schools, and clinic-based environments.
* **Data Collection and Analysis:** Accurately collect and record data on client behavior during therapy sessions. Collaborate with BCBAs to analyze data and make necessary adjustments to treatment plans.
* **Implement Behavior Intervention Plans (BIPs):** Follow individualized BIPs to address specific target behaviors and skill acquisition goals for each client.
* **Communication:** Maintain open and effective communication with clients' families, caregivers, and the multidisciplinary team to ensure continuity of care and progress monitoring.
* **Documentation:** Maintain detailed and organized client records, including session notes, data sheets, and progress reports, in compliance with company policies and regulations.
* **Professional Development:** Stay current with best practices in ABA therapy by attending training sessions, workshops, and pursuing ongoing RBT certification requirements.
* **Safety:** Ensure the safety and well-being of clients during therapy sessions, including implementing crisis intervention strategies if necessary.

**Qualifications:**

* Preferred but not required to hold a valid Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification.
* High school diploma or equivalent is required; bachelor's degree in a related field is a plus.
* Prior experience working in ABA therapy under a BCBA is required.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Patience, compassion, and a genuine desire to make a positive impact on the lives of clients and their families.
* Ability to follow instructions, adapt to changing circumstances, and work collaboratively as part of a team.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive compensation and opportunities for career growth.
* Ongoing training and professional development.
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance available.
* A supportive and collaborative work environment dedicated to improving the lives of individuals with autism.

**How to Apply:**  
If you are passionate about helping individuals with autism reach their full potential and meet the qualifications mentioned above, we invite you to apply for the BA/ Registered Behavior Technician position at Stepping Stones ABA via indeed. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

title: Lead Healthcare Economics Analyst
description:
Summary:
* Provide guidance to a team of financial analysts who provide timely, accurate, actionable data and analysis supporting the department, other business areas, and corporate key initiatives.
* Proactively initiate and develop analytics for strategic and operating decisions and provide recommendations to senior management.
* Design and lead development of data-driven analysis for decision making on how EmblemHealth purchases, manages, and influences the cost of care for current and prospective members.
* Analyze, and interpret data to produce insights related to cost drivers, opportunities to impact costs, and impact of health cost containment initiatives.
* Provide consultative support to aligned business areas to demonstrate analytics rooted in data.


Responsibilities:
* Design and lead execution of analytics and reporting to measure or estimate financial impact of health plan business problems and potential or actual solutions.
* Provide leadership across all functions within Healthcare Economics including monitoring of specific corporate and health cost containment initiatives.
* May lead/mentor less experienced staff.
* Research and analyze financial data to draw conclusions and provide consultation to internal and external partners for use in administering specific programs and processes related to medical expense and utilization.
* Provide guidance and subject matter expertise to perform complex analyses; serve as point of escalation to resolve the most complex issues.
* Present analytical findings to internal and external business partners.
* Plan, conduct and direct work on complex projects/programs related to financial experience of the health plan,particularly related to how care is purchased, managed, or other factors influencing cost of care.
* Advise management in long-range planning for areas of specialization.
* Perform additional duties as assigned.


Requirements:
* BA/BS Required in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Healthcare or other related discipline; Master’s preferred
* 5 – 8+ years of relevant, professional work experience required
* Experience working in a healthcare setting (within a provider health system or health insurance company) preferred
* Experience working with healthcare data including but not limited to claims, testing results and pharmacy data required
* High level of proficiency with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.), with an emphasis on Excel required
* Strong communication skills (verbal, written, presentation, interpersonal) required
* Experience preparing/presenting dashboards and data using a data visualization tool such as Tableau preferred
* Ability to query, summarize, and manipulate data using SQL or SAS required

title: Care Manager, Complex & Disease Management
description:
Summary of Job:

Provide care management, as part of a multi-disciplinary care team, that includes care coordination, performing telephonic or face-to-face assessments of members’ health care needs, identifying gaps in care and needed support, administering/coordinating implementation of interventions. Support and enable members to manage their physical, environmental and psycho-social concerns, understand and appropriately utilize their health plan benefits and remain safe and independent in their home or current living environment in collaboration with health care providers. Provide Care Management services to identified high risk members within the community, including but not limited to Physician Practices, Retail Centers/Neighborhood Care Centers, and members’ homes. Coordinate and provide care that is safe, timely, effective, efficient and member-centered to support population health,  

transitions of care, and complex care management initiatives. Engage with the most complex members of the health plan with the goal of improving health care outcomes and appropriate and timely utilization of services across the continuum of care. Assist the entire Care Management interdisciplinary team in managing members with Care Management needs.

Responsibilities:
* Assess and evaluate the needs of our most complex members, acting as the clinical coordinator collaborating with members, caregivers, providers, multi-disciplinary team, and health care and community resources through a variety of assessments to identify areas of (medical, financial, environmental, health insurance benefit, psycho-social, caregiving) concerns and potential gaps in care utilizing the most appropriate resources to support members’ needs.
* Identify appropriate goals, strategies and interventions that may include referrals, health education, activation of community-based resources, life planning, or program/agency referrals based on areas of concern.
* Develop, communicate and evaluate medical management strategies and interventions including potential for alternative solutions to ensure high quality, cost effective continuum of care with the member, caregiver, provider(s) and multidisciplinary team.
* Include member and family as appropriate.
* Engage actively with the member PCP / designee.
* Engage with the member in support of their treatment team to identify and establish attainable goals that positively impact clinical, financial, and quality of life outcomes for member.
* Work collaboratively with all stake holders to ensure knowledge of the action plan, including participation in telephonic and face-to-face case conferences when appropriate.
* Assess the needs of members and align them with the appropriate member of the care team (wellness team, registered dietitian, social worker, community health workers).
* Act as the member’s advocate and liaison by completing or facilitating interventions with providers and/or private, non-profit, and governmental agencies.
* Ensure that all Care Management processes and reporting are compliant with all applicable federal and state regulations, and NCQA and company standards.
* Participate in delegation collaboration activities, as required.
* Research evidence-based guidelines, medical protocols, provider networks, and on-line resources in making care management recommendations.
* Enter and maintain documentation in the Electronic Medical Records System (EMR), meeting defined timeframes and performance standards.
* Maintain an understanding of Care Management principles, program objectives and design, implementation, management, monitoring, and reporting.
* Actively participate on assigned committees.
* Attend and complete all department-mandated training as well as satisfy educational in-service requirements.
* Perform other related projects and duties as assigned.
* Provide ongoing monitoring, evaluation, support and guidance to the coordination of the member's health care.
* Develop, implement and coordinate plan of care and facilitate members’ goals.
* Coordinate interdisciplinary team tasks and activities, with the goal of maintaining team performance and high morale.


Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree
* RN with current active RN license (Required)
* CCM certification (Preferred)
* Certified Diabetes Educator (CDE/CDCES) (Required)
* 4 – 6 years of clinical experience (Required)
* Organization/prioritization ability; and the ability to effectively manage a caseload of highly complex members (Required)
* Support an integrated care model tapping into appropriate resources both internally and external to the organization (Required)
* Experience in case management/care coordination, managed care, and/or utilization management (Preferred)
* Strong communication skills (verbal, written, presentation, interpersonal) (Required)
* Trained in the use of Motivational Interviewing techniques (Preferred)
* Experience working in medical facility or practice and/or with electronic medical records (Preferred)
* Computer proficiency: MS Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook); mobile technology (wireless phone/laptop, etc.) (Required)
* System user experience in a highly automated environment (Required)
* Bilingual ability (verbal, written) (Preferred)
* Strong cross-group collaboration, teamwork, problem solving, and decision-making skills (Required)
* Ability to work a flexible schedule (evenings, weekends and holidays) to meet member and/or caregiver and departmental scheduling needs (Required)
Additional Information


* Job Type: Standard
* Schedule: Full-time
* Employee Status: Regular
* Requisition ID: 1000001957\\_02
* Hiring Range: $63,000-$110,000

title: Account Executive
description:
$77,250 per annum to $ 82,600 per annum  

The GSM Solutions at Home of The New Jewish Home is seeking a full time Account Executive to join our team. This position will sit in Waters Place, Bronx.

  



The Account Executive will be responsible for driving client and revenue growth for our Private Pay Geriatric Care Management, Home Health Aide Services, and our Certified Home Health Agency. This individual will also be responsible for creating strategic partnerships among current and new referral sources, both with targeted external referral sources and within The New Jewish Home system.

  

**Reporting Responsibilities:**

  



This position will report directly to the Assistant Vice President of Home Care Programs with a dotted line to the Senior Vice President of Business Development

  


**General Duties and Responsibilities:**

  




* Drive admissions to the enhanced Solutions at Home (Private Pay) service line for The New Jewish Home, to include clients interested in private pay geriatric care management services, home health aide, and CHHA services.


* Collaborate with the Assistant Vice President of Home Care Services to develop and implement growth strategies that enhance the Solutions at Home program.


* Build The New Jewish Home brand awareness to increase portfolio and market presence through alignment with major referral networks and upstream health providers.


* Responsible for developing and maintaining relationships and driving private pay admissions with external referral sources such as health systems, physician organizations and ACOs, post-acute care networks, concierge and high volume physician groups, area agencies for the elderly, faith-based organizations, property management companies, elder law attorneys and financial/wealth advisors.


* Drive partnership and acquisition efforts, increasing patient admissions, profitability and new opportunities for Solutions at Home (Private Pay Services) business expansion.


* Serve as a liaison for operational and quality issues

  


* Assist in maintaining up-to-date information on overall market trends and competitors including pricing, census, product information, and current market strategies as it relates to products/services under consideration.


* Promote The New Jewish Home in both an intra-organizational level as well as with external organizations via committee work, networking and liaison activities, to build all Solutions at Home services.


* Maintain professional competency through participation in independent intra- or external agency learning experiences. Attend and participate in community based meetings and conferences appropriate to the needs and development of Solutions at Home services.


* Partner with the Senior Vice President of Business Development to drive strategic growth improvements to the program and across the organization.


* Demonstrates a high degree of commitment to customer service and quality clinical practice

  


**Qualifications:**

  


* Three to five years of business development experience, or marketing/sales required.
* Proven record of new account development, with a preferred history of success in the development of private pay generating accounts.
* A willingness to work within a team environment.
* Demonstrates a passion for serving the elderly and meeting the health and wellness needs of this population


* Possesses an entrepreneurial orientation and a desire to build a growth business for a new venture within a larger organization


* Possesses persuasive communication skills, impeccable customer service skills, and flexibility to adapt to different business environments.
* Prior home health sales and knowledge of New York Metropolitan area required.


* Knowledge of specialty aging care services for the elderly such as Alzheimer’s/Dementia and Palliative within the home health care arena a plus.

  


**Age Related Skills and Competencies:**

  


* Able to satisfactorily deal with the adult and elderly population.

  


**Physical Demands:**

  


* Ability to walk in order to visit with clients, as needed

  



Additional Requirements:

  


* Must have reliable transportation and be willing to travel to Manhattan, Brooklyn, Bronx; Queens; Westchester & Nassau Counties


* Willing to represent the New Jewish Home at networking and sales functions outside of normal working hours, as needed
company_description: The New Jewish Home, formerly Jewish Home Lifecare, is a nonprofit that provides care for the evolving needs of New Yorkers as they age.

title: Human Resources Coordinator
description:
**Company Overview:**


Health disparities among New Yorkers are large, persistent, and increasing. Public Health Solutions (PHS) exists to change that trajectory and support vulnerable New York City families in achieving optimal health and building pathways to reach their potential.


As the largest public health nonprofit serving New York City, we improve health outcomes and help communities thrive by providing services directly to vulnerable low-income families, supporting community-based organizations through our long-standing public-private partnerships, and bridging the gap between healthcare and community services. We focus on a wide range of public health issues including food and nutrition, health insurance, maternal and child health, sexual and reproductive health, tobacco control, and HIV/AIDS. To learn more about our work, please visit healthsolutions.org.

**This is a grant-funded position ending November 30, 2027.**

**Position Summary:**


The Human Resources Coordinator handles and provides support in the areas of Talent Management, Recruitment, Onboarding, and HR Compliance.

**The Human Resources Coordinator will:**

* Conduct full-cycle recruitment - identify and recruit top talent through efficient and cost-effective recruiting methods by understanding and following the staffing and recruitment process, including but not limited to creating and maintaining job descriptions, job posting, screening resumes, phone screens, interviewing, perform background checks and making job offer.
* Ensure a positive candidate experience through timely communication and a professional recruitment process.
* Maintain accurate records of candidate interactions and recruitment activities in the applicant tracking system (ATS).
* Attends and participates in career, college and community job fairs.
* Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and company policies during the hiring process.
* Stay updated on employment benefits and applicable regulations to provide candidates with accurate information.
* Work with recruiters to develop partnerships and working relationships that deliver a great candidate and hiring manager experience.
* Maintains personnel files in compliance with applicable legal requirements.
* Completes employment verifications and PSLF documents.
* Weekly update and send IT the DOHMH email list.
* Prepare and email monthly birthday ecards.
* Assist with monthly All Staff Call.
* Support engagement activities and all HR projects or initiatives as needed.
* Prepare and generate ad-hoc reports.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Human Resources or a related field.
* 2-3 years of experience in human resources.
* Knowledge of computer software (Microsoft Office Suite) and human resources related systems.
* Ability to multi-task.
* High level of interpersonal skills to handle sensitive and confidential situations and documentation.
* Attention to detail in composing, typing and proofing materials, establishing priorities, and meeting deadlines.
* Excellent organizational, written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
* Ability to take on new opportunities and face challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.
* Ability to maintain the highest level of integrity, professionalism, fairness and confidentiality.
* Salary: $62,400 - $62,400

**Benefits:**

* Hybrid Work Schedule.
* Generous Paid Time Off and Holidays.
* An attractive and comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental and Vision.
* Flexible Spending Accounts and Commuter Benefits.
* Company Paid Life Insurance and Disability Coverage.
* 403 (b) + employer matching and discretionary company contributions.
* College Savings Plan.
* Ongoing trainings and continuous opportunities for professional growth and development.

*At PHS, we place immense value on diversity within our teams, understanding that varied backgrounds and experiences significantly enhance our community and propel us toward our goals. If you find you don’t have experience in all the areas listed above, we still encourage you to apply and share your background and experiences in your application. We are eager to discover how your unique perspective can bring positive transformations to our team and help advance our mission of creating healthier, more equitable communities.*

*We look forward to learning more about you!*

*PHS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from women, people of color, persons with disabilities, lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender individuals, and veterans.*

  

  

Monday-Friday, 9:00 am - 5:00 pm  

35 hours per week

title: Global Supplier Management Group and Global Workplace and Enterprise Svcs Emerging Talent Program
description:
**Job Description**

**Position Description:**

**Global Supplier Management Group and Global Workplace and Enterprise Svcs Emerging Talent Program**


The Global Supplier Management Group (GSMG) and Global Workplace and Enterprise Services (GWES) are seeking candidates for our emerging talent rotational program. Our team is responsible for engaging and developing suppliers to meet all our business needs, as well as acquiring, fitting out, operating and maintaining our global real estate portfolio in support of a productive workforce.

**Emerging Talent Rotational (ETR) Program:**


The ETR Program aims to develop a diverse, talented network of procurement and facilities professionals and future business leaders. This program provides unique exposure and investment opportunities to enhance technical, business, and leadership skills. Participants will gain a deep understanding of our business, procurement, and facilities processes, making meaningful contributions to the company's economic and value goals.

**Position Qualifications****:**

**Education Minimum Requirement:**

* Bachelor’s Degree OR
* minimum of a high school diploma with at least 2 years of professional experience.

**Required Experience and Skills:**

* Ideal candidates demonstrate leadership abilities, are analytical, inquisitive, perceptive, quick learners, and are committed to advancing our vision and mission.

**Additional Competencies:**

* Adaptability to new roles, teams, and situations, with a willingness to rotate through different procurement and facility-related roles over the 3-year program.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and maintain professionalism under pressure.
* Strong communication skills, both in-person and in writing.
* Self-starter with a strong work ethic and problem-solving abilities.
* Thrive in a diverse and inclusive culture.

**Program Structure:**


New hires will experience three rotations over three years in various business areas throughout GSMG & GWES, primarily in PA & NJ offices.

**Your Role:**


Your contributions are vital to advancing global medical breakthroughs that benefit future generations. We rely on your skills and inventiveness to make meaningful impacts.

Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

title: AP Physics Teacher - Livingston
description:
**Teacher**


Hourly Pay Range: $21 - $30

**About C2 Education**


At C2 Education, we believe in our students and their potential for greatness. We change lives every day by helping students achieve their academic goals so they may attend the college of their dreams. We assist with multiple educational needs such as; College Test Prep, AP Exam, College Essay, and College Admissions. In addition, we offer tutoring for K-12 and AP/Summer Boot Camps.

**Why Join our Team**


As an employee of C2 Education you will be living out our mission, vision, and values. This provides you with a chance to enhance not only your life but the lives of the students you work with. Previous teaching experience is highly desired; however, no teacher certification or licensure is necessary.


Pay ranges from $21 - $30 per hour depending on multiple factors, including specific location, individuals knowledge, skills, and experience. In addition to the competitive pay, this role offers part-time benefits, including:

* 401(k) plus a dollar for dollar match up to 4% contribution after six months of employment.
* Paid initial training and ongoing training.
* Employee discounts through PerkSpot.
* Employer referral program.
* Discounted tutoring hours.

**Responsibilities**


Our teachers work in small groups with students at a 3 student to one teacher ratio. C2 Education offers teachers strong administrative and leadership support so they can focus solely on what matters: helping students. Our Education Coordinators and Center Directors for each center take care of the scheduling. Center Directors and District Managers handle communication with parents.

* Tutor students in small groups (3 students max).
* Tailor C2 Educations proprietary curriculum on SAT, ACT, AP, and school subjects to students needs.
* Track and analyze student progress.
* Attending required training and staff meetings.

**Schedule**

* Sessions are conducted after school hours to accommodate students and are typically Monday Thursday 1:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. and Saturdays 9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Each location may vary.

**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelors Degree (B.A./B.S.).
* Ability to tutor in-person.
* Score at the 95th percentile on our diagnostic SAT, AP, or ACT test.
* Authorized to work in the US.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* AP-level knowledge in at least one or more subjects.


The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the priorities, skills and abilities required to do the job.C2 Education provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, military or veterans status, genetics or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition to federal law requirements, C2 Education complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has operations. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
company_description: C2 Education is the nation's fastest growing network of school subject tutoring, SAT/ACT/PSAT/SSAT test prep, tutoring, and educational support centers.

title: Supervisor, Contracts Administration
description:
Founded in 1918, Kearfott Corporation, a global Aerospace and Defense supplier for over 100 years, is a leader in the design and manufacture of precision motion control products and inertial navigation components. Kearfott has a very long history of innovation and excellence and is the go-to brand for many of our global clients. Kearfott is trusted, respected and plays a vital role in the success of America’s aerospace and defense industries. With over a century of expertise & experience, Kearfott is dedicated to providing quality, reliability, and cutting-edge technology to customers worldwide to meet their sea, land, air, and space navigation and guidance requirements.


Kearfott offers a comprehensive benefits package including a 401K, and Tuition Reimbursement. We offer a 9/80 schedule with every other Friday off, and flexible work options for most positions.


We are looking for talented individuals who want to be part of a world class work force. Join Kearfott and become part of a company that is recognized for technical expertise and respected world-wide as a ‘full service’ provider. For more information visit our website at www.kearfott.com.

 **Position Description**


This position will be responsible for execution of the business and departmental strategies and processes including supervision of Contracts Administration personnel engaged in the preparation of proposals, negotiation of contracts, and administration of commercial and government contacts.

  

This position is responsible for developing and training the personnel in the department.

 **Essential Functions**

* Provide day-to-day supervision and direction to assigned Contracts Administration personnel executing responsibilities in contract administration. Contracts department responsibilities include, but are not limited to, management of contractual and other agreements, coordination of proposals, customer relationship management, and record keeping of communications and documents.
* Supervise and assist (as required) the negotiation of all assigned proposals for contractual language.
* Review bids, request for proposals, specifications, and requirements for consistency and accuracy
* Recommend and implement specific course of action to be taken to satisfy customer inquiries regarding contract requirements.
* Monitor customer provided metrics as well as internal metrics to ensure alignment. Coordinate metric reviews with customer as required to ensure actual performance is accurately displayed in customer metrics.
* Develop and maintain good working relationships with customer contacts. Learn customer programs and applications and look for opportunities to encourage additional sales.
* Maintain complete and accurate files to facilitate internal administration and audits.
* Evaluate team member responsibilities, processes, and tasks for recommended improvements towards a leaner and more efficient workflow.
* Provide coverage for customer accounts as required for team member PTO or unusually heavy workloads
* Lead Contracts team on execution of assigned tasks related to strategic and functional initiatives.
* Act as leader and mentor to develop core talent on the team and monitor compliance to processes.
* Other duties as required by management

 **Critical Competencies**

* Must be highly organized, self-motivated, and thoroughly attentive to detail in all actions.
* Must have excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills and be able to communicate across all levels and functions of the organization.
* Must possess teamwork and leadership qualities, with the ability to train and mentor others.
* Must be able to function effectively and independently and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
* Must display organizational leadership skills and be a team player.

 **Education & Experience**

* BA/BS required, Business, Law, Accounting, Communications, Marketing preferred.
* Minimum of 3 years' experience in customer service, contracts management, order management, or similar areas of responsibility required.
* 2-3 years progressive leadership experience and/or project management required.
* Previous experience managing others preferred.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office software
* Knowledge of US Government contract administration including all FAR and DFAR regulations required.
* Knowledge of US Export Control Regulations including ITAR and EAR compliance
* Prior experience with contracts, legal terminology, and negotiation required.
* Must be legally authorized to work in the US, visa sponsorship not available
* Must have the ability to work on government contracts
* Travel required up to 25%

  

Equal Opportunity Employer


We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.
company_description: Kearfott has developed and maintained a reputation for high-quality, high-reliability and cutting-edge technology. Kearfott products and systems are used in both commercial and military applications.

**Position:** Hospital Liaison  
**Location:** Riverdale, NY  
**Facility:** Methodist Home for Nursing & Rehabilitation

**About Us:**  
Founded in 1850, the Methodist Home for Nursing & Rehabilitation is a 120-bed Skilled Nursing Facility with a historic, hotel-like environment. We provide exceptional healthcare for both short-term rehabilitation and long-term care, dedicated to helping residents achieve optimum functioning and better health.

**Job Overview:**  
We are seeking an energetic, driven Hospital Liaison fluent in Spanish and English to join our team. This role involves building a referral base, coordinating patient admissions, and overseeing marketing initiatives for our facility. The ideal candidate will engage with hospital case managers, discharge planners, and local assisted living and adult homes. Responsibilities include implementing marketing programs, establishing relationships with hospitals and physicians, and leveraging successful sales experience in healthcare to enhance patient referrals and admissions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain relationships with hospital case managers, discharge planners, and local care facilities.
* Coordinate patient admissions and oversee facility marketing initiatives.
* Promote the facility’s clinical outcomes and services.
* Implement effective marketing and sales programs in the local area.
* Utilize a successful record of sales experience in a healthcare setting to drive patient referrals and admissions.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum of 1 year of successful sales experience in a healthcare setting.
* Fluent in Spanish and English.
* Existing connections in the area or ability to establish them.
* Proven ability to understand and communicate technical information (e.g., clinical outcomes, data points).
* Proficient with social media platforms including Facebook and Instagram.
